pages.title: BCFHD distributes the first cash installment to the fishermen’s HHs in in Mocha . – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD distributes the first cash installment to the fishermen’s HHs in in Mocha
pages.content: BCFHD distributes the first cash installment to the fishermen’s HHs in in Mocha . Funded by YHF and within the project of “Improving Access To Education In Al-Wazi’ah District And The Livelihoods Of Fishermen’s HHs In Mocha District “, BCFHD launched the first round of cash assistance distribution. Riyad Salam, the project manager, explained that the disbursement of cash assistance is the first stage of the project that aims to empower fishermen and improve their livelihoods by supporting them with fishing tools that will take place in the second stage. He added: The project targets (500) fishermen’s HHs who were chosen according to the criteria of the FSAC in coordination with the local authority and the committees representing the beneficiaries in in Mocha district. He pointed out that the project mechanism includes cash transfers for three monthly sessions. And he stressed that the project was implemented with the participation of women in the community committee, registration team, verification team and distribution team.

pages.title: BCFHD concludes the payment  of the second cash installment  related to rental-assistance in Taiz governorate. – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD concludes the payment of the second cash installment related to rental-assistance in Taiz governorate
pages.content: BCFHD concludes the payment of the second cash installment related to rental-assistance in Taiz governorate. Funded by YHF, BCFHD concluded the activity of distributing the second cash installment related to rental-assistance, which lasted for five days, from June 22 to June 28, 2020. This activity comes within the shelter project for ” Suporting the most vulnerable IDPs with life- saving rental assistannce and NFIs, and SMC in hosting sites In Al-Mudhafar, Salah And AL-Qahirah Districts in Taiz Governorate” It is worth mentioning that the number of beneficiaries of this aid is 500 of the most affected HHs and they will be targeted for six months. All precautions were taken against Covid-19 during the distribution.

pages.title: BCFHD concludes the training course for volunteers at the IPDs sites in Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD concludes the training course for volunteers at the IPDs sites in Taiz BCFHD concluded the training course about the media campaigns for volunteers in the IDPs sites
pages.content: BCFHD concludes the training course for volunteers at the IPDs sites in Taiz BCFHD concluded the training course about the media campaigns for volunteers in the IDPs sites . This activity comes within the shelter project of “Suporting the most vulnerable IDPs with life- saving rental assistannce and NFIs, and SMC in hosting sites In Al-Mudhafar, Salah And AL-Qahirah Districts in Taiz Governorate”.The course lasted for three days, during which the volunteers were introduced to the importance of voluntary work, skills and attributes that they must possess.And how to deal with the diseases spread in the city. Osama Al-Mahdi, director of the IDPs site, said that this session targeted 12 volunteers from the targeted area.

pages.title: BCFHD launches the activity of distributing agricultural and animal livelihoods in Al-Mokha districts – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches the activity of distributing agricultural and animal livelihoods in Al-Mokha districts Funded by FAO, BCFHD launched the activity of distributing agricultural and animal...
pages.content: BCFHD launches the activity of distributing agricultural and animal livelihoods in Al-Mokha districts Funded by FAO, BCFHD launched the activity of distributing agricultural and animal livelihoods in Al-Mukha districts, this activity comes within the project of “Distributing Agricultural Inputs to the Most Affected HHs In the Districts of Mukha, Dhu Bab, Al-Wazia and Mouza’a”. The activity started by distributing poultry feed to 350 HHs in Mukha and Mouza’a. Dr. Faisal Al-Sabri, project manager, said that the activity will continue for 25 days and it will target 5350 beneficiaries

pages.title: BCFHD carries out drinking water distribution activity for some areas of Taiz governorate – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD carries out drinking water distribution activity for some areas of Taiz governorate Funded by the ECHO and in partnership with the IRC, BCFHD launched the activity of distributing drinking...
pages.content: BCFHD carries out drinking water distribution activity for some areas of Taiz governorate Funded by the ECHO and in partnership with the IRC, BCFHD launched the activity of distributing drinking water in Salh district and the IDP sites in Taiz governorate at a rate of (138 cubic meters ) per day within the project of “Emergency Response to Prevention of COVID19”. The project is accompanied by monitoring water quality through specialized team to guarantee that people obtain clean drinking water on a daily basis. As well BCFHD undertakes awareness campaign on covid-19 through community volunteers who have been trained under the observation of Health office . People of the targeted areas expressed their thanks and gratitude to BCFHD and donors for their implementation of project, which they desperately need. The inauguration was attended by, the director of Salh district and by the project manager.

The inauguration was attended by, the director of Salh district and by the project manager.

headings.text: BCFHD carries out drinking water distribution activity for some areas of Taiz governorate

paragraphs: Funded by the ECHO and in partnership with the IRC, BCFHD launched the activity of distributing drinking water in Salh district and the IDP sites in Taiz governorate at a rate of (138 cubic meters ) per day within the project  of “Emergency Response to Prevention of COVID19”. The project is accompanied by monitoring water quality through specialized team to guarantee that people obtain clean drinking water on a daily basis. As well BCFHD undertakes awareness campaign on covid-19  through community volunteers who have been trained  under the observation of Health office .

People of the targeted areas expressed their thanks and gratitude to BCFHD and donors for their implementation of project, which they desperately need. The inauguration was attended by, the director of Salh district and by the project manager.

pages.title: BCFHD distributes double school seats to the schools of Al-Waziya District. – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD distributes double school seats to the schools of Al-Waziya District
pages.content: BCFHD distributes double school seats to the schools of Al-Waziya District. Funded by (YHF), BCFHD launched the distribution of school seats to the targeted schools within the project of” Access to Education in Al Wazi’iyah and Livelihoods for Highly Vulnerable Fishery Dependent Households in Al Mukha” . , In coordination with the Directorate of Education, the head of the local council in the district presented the distribution. Abdel-Alam Aqlan explained that the number of school seats that will be distributed is 557 double seats, for the benefit of 1114 students. He added: This activity comes within a series of activities that the project contained, represented in the restoration and rehabilitation of schools, training of teachers, distribution of school bags for students and a teacher’s bag, distribution of blackboards and hygiene bags for targeted schools within the framework of Al-Waziya district.

pages.title: BCFHD distributes Medicines to Taiz hospitals – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD distributes Medicines to Taiz hospitals Funded by the ECHO and in partnership with the IRC, BCFHD has launched the distribution of medicines and medical supplies to a number of Taiz...
pages.content: BCFHD distributes Medicines to Taiz hospitals Funded by the ECHO and in partnership with the IRC, BCFHD has launched the distribution of medicines and medical supplies to a number of Taiz hospitals, as part of the “Emergency Preparedness and Response Mechanism for the Covid-19 Pandemic”. The distribution included four hospitals in Taiz governorate , in coordination with the Public Health and Population Office in the governorate. For his part, Director of the Health Office, Dr. Rajeh Al-Maliki, thanked BCFHD and the donors for their efforts represented in the emergency response to the Corona crisis, which also included training health workers in the early stages of the epidemic, in addition to providing medicines, solutions, medical supplies and personal protective equipment.

pages.title: BCFHD starts renovating and rehabilitating schools in Al-Wazia’a district. – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD starts renovating and rehabilitating schools in Al-Wazia’a district
pages.content: BCFHD starts renovating and rehabilitating schools in Al-Wazia’a district. Funded by YHF BCFHD has started restoration and rehabilitation work for the targeted schools within the project of ” Access to Education in Al Wazi’iyah and Livelihoods for Highly Vulnerable Fishery Dependent Households in Al Mukha”). Mr. Abdul-Alim Aklan – the project officer – explained that the restoration and rehabilitation started in Monday, 13 July 2020. The contractor started his work in the restoration and rehabilitation after the schools were delivered in the presence of the Director of the Education Office in Al-Wazi’ah district. He added: The project targets 25 of the worst affected schools, which were identified in coordination with the local council and the education office Al-Wazi’ah . after signing an agreement of understanding with the local authority and the education office in the governorate. Aklan indicated that the project will later include distributing school bags to more than 9,000 students, and distributing school benches, blackboards, school supplies and hygiene bags, in addition to distributing bags for teachers and training them.

pages.summary: BCFHD holds the third meeting of the water and sanitation committees in Taiz BCFHD held the third meeting of the water and sanitation committee in Taiz within the activities of the project of...
pages.content: BCFHD holds the third meeting of the water and sanitation committees in Taiz BCFHD held the third meeting of the water and sanitation committee in Taiz within the activities of the project of “WASH Basic Services and Facilities for IDPs and Vulnerable People in Hosting Communities – Rehabilitation and Restoring – in High Priority Districts in Taiz (Al Misrakh, Al Mudhaffar, Al Qahirah and Salh)” As the implemented project activities and the rehabilitation projects that are still under implementation were reviewed, in the targeted districts in addition the committees were reminded of their tasks in facilitating the benefit of the activities. 25 members of water committees in the governorate attended the meeting, which took place in two phases, the first one was in Al-Mesrakh district and the second one was in the city.

pages.title: BCFHD participates in the “Taiz Cleanup” meeting – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD participates in the “Taiz Cleanup” meeting BCFHD participated in the meeting with the Deputy Governor of Taiz, Mr
pages.content: BCFHD participates in the “Taiz Cleanup” meeting BCFHD participated in the meeting with the Deputy Governor of Taiz, Mr. Aref Jamel, who discussed with the representatives of a number of international and local organizations their interventions in cleaning the city. In Sunday, June 12, 2020 and in the presence of Mr. Abdullah Jassar, the Executive Director of the Fund, Aref Jamel discussed the interventions of BCFHD, CARE International and Mercy Corps, in the cleanliness of the city in coordination with the Cleanliness and Improvement Fund in the city. For his part, the Executive Director of the Cleaning Fund, Abdullah Jassar, reviewed the fund’s plan for cleaning the city by dividing the city’s districts into boxes, explaining in the plan the needs for those boxes in terms of workers, equipment, supervisors, and others, according to a studied plan. The agent Jamel stressed that the work should be done in an organized manner, away from randomness, and that these interventions include all neighborhoods and residential neighborhoods in the city completely, indicating that these interventions came simultaneously with the directions of the local authority leadership in the field of environmental rehabilitation, which should be integrated, in order to alleviate the suffering Citizens are showing the city aesthetically, free from disease and epidemics. The provincial governor appreciated the efforts of BCFHD, CARE and Mercy Corps for their interventions in cleaning the city, stressing that the local authority will work to cooperate with them, facilitate their tasks and overcome the difficulties that may hinder the conduct of their work. The meeting was attended by Deputy Director of the Cleaning and Improvement Fund in the Governorate, Arafat Jamil, and Director of the Cleaning Project, Abdullah Al-Yousifi.

pages.content: “BCFHD” concludes the distribution of modern whiteboards to Al-Wazi’iya schools. Zaid Al-Ameri – Deputy Project Director – said Al-Waziya District leads the rest of the districts by installing modern whiteboards in all its schools, which makes this activity comes within the the project of”” Access to Education in Al Wazi’iyah”

pages.title: BCFHD launches teacher training  course in Al Waziyah – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches teacher training course in Al Waziyah Funded by YHF, BCFHD launched a training course for male and female teachers on the basics of education in case of emergency and psychological...
pages.content: BCFHD launches teacher training course in Al Waziyah Funded by YHF, BCFHD launched a training course for male and female teachers on the basics of education in case of emergency and psychological support for students, in the presence of Professor Ali Al-Zarafi, Director of the Education Office in the Directorate. Abdel-Alam Aqlan – the project officer – explained that the project targets 200 male and female teachers who were selected according to specific criteria from all schools in the district, as part of “Access to Education in Al Wazi’iyah” project. He added: We planned for the training to coincide with the start of the new academic year 2020/2021, as the training included a number of active activities and work groups. It is worth mentioning that the project distributed 557 double school seats during the past month, in addition to distributing 201 whiteboards with their supplies to all schools in the district. The project also includes the restoration and rehabilitation of 25 schools currently underway, and the distribution of hygiene bags to the targeted schools, while it will later include the distribution of 9,345 school bags for students and 525 bags for male and female teachers. The inauguration was attended by the Head of the Training and Rehabilitation Department and the Head of the Community Participation Section in the Education Office in Al-Wazi’iya.

pages.title: The director of Al Wazi’iya directorate visits a teacher training center. – BCFHD
pages.summary: The director of Al Wazi’iya directorate visits a teacher training center Monday, September 7, 2020, Mr
pages.content: The director of Al Wazi’iya directorate visits a teacher training center. Monday, September 7, 2020, Mr. Ahmed Al-Dharafi, Director of Al-Waziya District, visited Al-Zahraa Center, one of the teacher training centers on the basics of education in case of emergency, which was implemented by BCFHD as part of “Access to Education in Al Wazi’iyah” project . Al-Dharafi praised the pioneering educational projects implemented by BCFHD in the district, stressing that the local authority will spare no effort in overcoming the difficulties for BCFHD and other organizations to implement projects easily and easily for targeted Beneficiaries During his tour, he met male and female teachers, and praised the training activity as a basic complement to the rest of the project activities, saying Training is the most important part in the development of the educational process.

pages.summary: The conclusion of the training of the first teachers group in Al Wazi’iya BCFHD continues training on the basics of education in an emergency targeting 200 male and female teachers in Al Waziya...
pages.content: The conclusion of the training of the first teachers group in Al Wazi’iya BCFHD continues training on the basics of education in an emergency targeting 200 male and female teachers in Al Waziya District. The training of the first group of 40 male and female trainees was concluded, which was carried out during two consecutive days in the Zahraa Center in Zarifa sub-district. The trainees praised the training program, which included workshops, various activities, and practical applications through qualified trainers who have accumulated experience in this field. The training was concluded with the distribution of participation certificates to all trainees.

pages.title: BCFHD holds the sixth coordination meeting among organizations in Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD holds the sixth coordination meeting among organizations in Taiz BCFHD holds the sixth coordination meeting among organizations in Taiz city within the activities of the project of...
pages.content: BCFHD holds the sixth coordination meeting among organizations in Taiz BCFHD holds the sixth coordination meeting among organizations in Taiz city within the activities of the project of “Supporting The Most Vulnerable IDPs With Life-Saving Rental Assistance And NFIs, And SMC In Hosting Sites in Al-Muzaffar, Sala and Cairo districts” Eng. Mutahar Al-Shumairi, Project Manager, explained that these meetings aim to enhance the level of coordination of humanitarian efforts with service providers from partners and organizations in order to provide services and needs for the sites of the displaced in the city. In this meeting, needs of the displaced sites in the city are reviewed, in the presence of their representatives. The meeting concluded with a set of recommendations and proposals related to meeting the needs of the displaced in the IDP hosting sites in Taiz. It is worth mentioning that the meeting was attended by Mr. Craig Kniesi, coordinator of Médecins Sans Frontières( MSF.org.)

pages.title: BCFHD organizes an entertainment day for 230 orphans and their mothers – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD organizes an entertainment day for 230 orphans and their mothers Funded by “Life org ” and in partnership with “Pure Hands org
pages.content: BCFHD organizes an entertainment day for 230 orphans and their mothers Funded by “Life org.” and in partnership with “Pure Hands org.”, (BCFHD) concluded, the “Recreational Day for Orphans”,as part of its efforts aimed at supporting children in the psychological field due to the circumstance which Yemen is going through. Mr. Tariq Al Hammadi, Executive Director of BCFHD, expressed his thanks to Pure Hands and the Life Organizations for their generous financing of the project. Mr. Suleiman Ali – Project Officer at BCFHD – explained that this day was welcomed by the participants from the children and mothers and brought joy to their hearts, drawing a smile on their faces . Ammar Al-Samit, the Guarantees Officer at BCFHD, said that the “Recreational Day for Orphans” that BCFHD held in Garden City Park contained new and innovative entertainment activities and activities from the psychological support team.

pages.title: BCFHD concludes  the training of 200 male and female teachers in Al-Waziya District – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD concludes the training of 200 male and female teachers in Al-Waziya District Funded by YHF, BCFHD has concluded training of 200 teachers in Al-Waziya on the basics of education in case of...
pages.content: BCFHD concludes the training of 200 male and female teachers in Al-Waziya District Funded by YHF, BCFHD has concluded training of 200 teachers in Al-Waziya on the basics of education in case of emergency and psychological support for students within the the project of”” Access to Education in Al Wazi’iyah”. Riad Shamsan – Project Manager, expressed his happiness at the conclusion of the training activity for teachers, stressing the importance of this training as it is held for the first time for teachers in the targeted district, and it also meets the needs of the teachers to acquire learning methods and methods of psychological support for students under the current circumstances which the country is going through. In the same context, Abdel-Alam Aqlan – Education Officer – explained that the targeted teachers were selected according to specific criteria from all the districts’ schools, with the approval of the Education Office in the district and in coordination with the Education Office in the governorate. He added: the teachers from 32 schools participated in the training during 10 days, as they were divided into 5 groups, each group received training for two days. He emphasized that more emphasis was placed on practical applications, noting that the training was carried out in 3 centers, including workshops, various activities and practical methods. And he revealed the outcomes of the training, that the teachers acquired modern teaching skills and methods and methods of psychological support in case of emergency, which will have a great impact on improving the students ’learning level and providing them with knowledge using modern and advanced scientific methods. Professor Ali Dabwan – one of the trainers in the course, praised BDFHD for targeting Al Waziyah district in training male and female teachers in the current circumstances, as the district is scarce in implementing training programs. Mr. Abdullah Qahtan Shamakh also talked about the methods used in training, as they included effective and intense methods, the most prominent of which are (individual work, cooperative work “two-group” and discussion, training games, in addition to the expert session and pictures, and a thinking-pair-share style. Use of group rotation techniques, brainstorming) and other methods. On the other, the trainees – praised this course, for targeting the teachers in Al-Wazi’iya District during the current circumstances, as the training course met the needs of the participants, which will have an impact on the target group of male and female students, as they thanked BCFHD for its great efforts to improve education in Al Waziyah District, as well as thanked all the project team, headed by Professor Abdul Alam Aqlan, the Education Officer in the project, for his dedication to training and working in a sporting spirit.

headings.text: BCFHD concludes  the training of 200 male and female teachers in Al-Waziya District

paragraphs: Funded by YHF, BCFHD has concluded training of 200 teachers in Al-Waziya on the basics of education in case of emergency and psychological support for students within the the project of”” Access to Education in Al Wazi’iyah”.

Riad Shamsan – Project Manager, expressed his happiness at the conclusion of the training activity for teachers, stressing the importance of this training as it is held for the first time for teachers in the targeted district, and it also meets the needs of the teachers to acquire learning methods and methods of psychological support for students under the current circumstances which the  country is going through.

In the same context, Abdel-Alam Aqlan – Education Officer – explained that the targeted teachers were selected according to specific criteria from all the districts’ schools, with the approval of the Education Office in the district and in coordination with the Education Office in the governorate.

He added: the teachers from 32 schools participated in the training during 10 days, as they were divided into 5 groups, each group received training for two days. He emphasized that more emphasis was placed on practical applications, noting that the training was carried out in 3 centers, including workshops, various activities and practical methods.

And he revealed the outcomes of the training, that  the teachers acquired modern teaching skills and methods and methods of psychological support in case of emergency, which will have a great impact on improving the students ’learning level and providing them with knowledge using modern and advanced scientific methods.

pages.title: BCFHD distributes the sixth cash installment  related to rental-assistance in Taiz governorate. – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD distributes the sixth cash installment related to rental-assistance in Taiz governorate
pages.content: BCFHD distributes the sixth cash installment related to rental-assistance in Taiz governorate. Funded by YHF, BCFHD distributed the sixth installment of cash assistance related to rental-subsides to IDPs in Taiz governorate within the project of” Supporting the most vulnerable IDPs with life- saving rental assistance and NFIs, and SMC in hosting sites In Al-Mudhafar, Salah And AL-Qahirah Districts in Taiz Governorate” Engineer / Osama Abdel-Jabbar, the project coordinator, stated that this is the last cash installment related to rental-assistance for 500 beneficiaries. The prevention procedures against covid_19 were followed during the distribution process.

pages.title: BCFHD concludes the  training of  the water committees on managing and maintaining solar energy systems for water projects. – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD concludes the training of the water committees on managing and maintaining solar energy systems for water projects
pages.content: BCFHD concludes the training of the water committees on managing and maintaining solar energy systems for water projects. Funded by YHF, BCFHD concluded the training of water committees on managing, operating and maintaining solar energy systems for water projects that were rehabilitated in Al Misrakh District. Eng. Mutahar Al-Shumairi – Project Manager – explained that the training activity comes within the framework of the project “”WASH basic services and facilities for IDPs and vulnerable people in hosting communities – rehabilitation and restoring – in high priority districts in Taiz” He referred that the second training was implemented during (October 5 th -6 th ) targeting (6 males, 6 females) of GARWASP employees, specializing in operating water projects in the targeted districts, by trainers from (LWSC) and (GARWASP). It is worth mentioning that the training included components of solar powered pumping systems, as well as operations and maintenance, and managing the common errors that may occur. The training also touched on the issue of activating the principle of accountability towards the beneficiaries and activating an effective communication mechanism between them and the local water and wastewater corporation.

It is worth mentioning  that the training included components of solar powered pumping systems, as well as operations and maintenance, and managing  the common errors that may occur.

The training also touched on the issue of activating the principle of accountability towards the beneficiaries and activating an effective communication mechanism between them and the local water and wastewater corporation.

pages.summary: BCFHD continues to train the water committees on managing and maintaining solar energy systems for water projects
pages.content: BCFHD continues to train the water committees on managing and maintaining solar energy systems for water projects. Funded by YHF, BCFHD implemented the training of water committees on managing, operating and maintaining solar energy system for water projects that were rehabilitated in Al Misrakh District. Eng. Mutahar Al-Shumairi – Project Manager – explained that the training activity comes within the framework of the project “ “WASH basic services and facilities for IDPs and vulnerable people in hosting communities – rehabilitation and restoring – in high priority districts in Taiz” He referred that the second training was implemented during (October 8 th -9 th ) targeting (9 males, 3 females) of GARWASP employees , specializing in operating water projects in the targeted districts, by trainers from (LWSC) and (GARWASP). pages.title: BCFHD distributes 135 dustbins in Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD distributes 135 dustbins in Taiz Funded by YHF, BCFHD distributed 135 dustbins in Al-Mudhaffar, Cairo, and Salaah districts in Taiz within the activities of the project of ” WASH basic...
pages.content: BCFHD distributes 135 dustbins in Taiz Funded by YHF, BCFHD distributed 135 dustbins in Al-Mudhaffar, Cairo, and Salaah districts in Taiz within the activities of the project of ” WASH basic services and facilities for IDPs and vulnerable people in hosting communities – rehabilitation and restoring – in high priority districts in Taiz” The project manager, Mutahhar Al-Shumairi, stated that this activity comes within the framework of covering the Urgent need for the dustbins in Taiz due to the accumulation of waste and the lack of a large number of areas for dustbins that can be installed and lifted on the compressors for garbage trucks of the Cleaning and Improvement Fund, and that this activity is a continuation of the activities of management Solid waste, which is represented by the transportation and removal of garbage, which lasted for five months from April to August 2020. The cleaning fund and BCFHD praised the awareness of citizens who contribute to preserving the environment by throwing waste into the dustbins in order to maintain the cleanliness of the city and reduce the burden on the cleaning workers during the lifting.

The cleaning fund and BCFHD praised the awareness of citizens who contribute to preserving the environment by throwing waste into the dustbins in order to maintain the cleanliness of the city and reduce the burden on the cleaning workers during the lifting.

headings.text: BCFHD distributes 135 dustbins in Taiz

paragraphs: Funded by YHF, BCFHD distributed 135 dustbins in Al-Mudhaffar, Cairo, and Salaah districts in Taiz within the activities of the project of ” WASH basic services and facilities for IDPs and vulnerable people in hosting communities – rehabilitation and restoring – in high priority districts in Taiz”

The project manager, Mutahhar Al-Shumairi, stated that this activity comes within the framework of covering the Urgent need for the dustbins in Taiz due to the accumulation of waste and the lack of a large number of areas for dustbins that can be installed and lifted on the compressors for garbage trucks of the Cleaning and Improvement Fund, and that this activity is a continuation of the activities of management Solid waste, which is represented by the transportation and removal of garbage, which lasted for five months from April to August 2020.

The  cleaning fund and BCFHD praised the awareness of citizens who contribute to preserving the environment by throwing waste into the dustbins in order to maintain the cleanliness of the city and reduce the burden on the cleaning workers during the lifting.

pages.title: BCFHD arranges  a Recreational day for the Deaf-mute – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD arranges a Recreational day for the Deaf-mute (BCFHD) arranged the Recreational Day for the Deaf-mute in Garden City Park, funding from the “Pure Hands” organization as An expression of its...
pages.content: BCFHD arranges a Recreational day for the Deaf-mute (BCFHD) arranged the Recreational Day for the Deaf-mute in Garden City Park, funding from the “Pure Hands” organization as An expression of its commitment to its community role in supporting people with special needs. Suleiman Ali – Project Officer at BCFHD – stated that 91 Deaf-mute children (48 males, 43 females) participated in this day, which comes within the framework of the psychological support project, as this was welcomed by the participants and brought joy to their hearts. Smiles were drawn on their lips, which leads to enhancing their sense of their Social status. He added: The program contained entertainment activities and events. In addition to playing in the amusement park, pointing out that the day ended with the distribution of gifts and prizes to the participants. Suleiman thanked and praised all the supervisors who contributed to the successful arrangement of this event.

pages.title: Funded by YHF and  in the presence of the Deputy Governor, BCFHD launches working on the Wadi Alqahdi Sanitation Pump Station in Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: Funded by YHF and in the presence of the Deputy Governor, BCFHD launches working on the Wadi Alqahdi Sanitation Pump Station in Taiz Dr
pages.content: Funded by YHF and in the presence of the Deputy Governor, BCFHD launches working on the Wadi Alqahdi Sanitation Pump Station in Taiz Dr. Abdul Qawi Al-Mikhlafi, Deputy Governor, inaugurated the Station in Wed. 28 th Oct., in Taiz, within the framework of the project of “”WASH basic services and facilities for IDPs and vulnerable people in hosting communities – rehabilitation and restoring – in high priority districts in Taiz” The Deputy Governor praised the efforts of BCFHD on the completion of work at the Station and the launch of working on it. Engineer / Mutahhar Al-Shumairi – Project Manager – explained that the station was completely stopped since 10 years, and it was rehabilitated. He added: The inauguration of work at the Station is expected to benefit 46,000 individuals of the targeted area. It is worth mentioning that the project included the implementation of several activities in 3 main sectors, the water, the sanitation, and the hygiene promotion sector.

pages.summary: BCFHD “concludes disbursing the NFIs assistance of the displaced HHs in AL-Qahirah and Al-Mudhafar
pages.content: BCFHD “concludes disbursing the NFIs assistance of the displaced HHs in AL-Qahirah and Al-Mudhafar. Funded by YHF, BCFHD concluded the 1 st stage of disruption activity of the NFIs cash assistance Al – Mudhafar and Al-Qahirah districts in Taiz city. Mutahar Al-Shumairi – Project Manager – stated that this activity comes within the activities of the shelter project namely, “Supporting the most vulnerable IDPs with life- saving rental assistance and NFIs, and SMC in hosting sites In Al-Mudhafar, Salah And AL-Qahirah Districts in Taiz Governorate” which targeted in the current stage 1000 beneficiaries in the two districts, through three distribution centers, for a period of a week, following the the prevention procedures against covid_19.

pages.title: BCFHD “hosts a child protection and  protection from mine training course for Education Cluster partners in Taiz. – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD “hosts a child protection and protection from mine training course for Education Cluster partners in Taiz
pages.content: BCFHD “hosts a child protection and protection from mine training course for Education Cluster partners in Taiz. For the second day, the training course in the field of “child protection and protection from mines” continues in Taiz city. The training course is organized by the Education Cluster in coordination with BCFHD, mdf, and the Executive Center for Mine Action, and hosted by “BCFHD” at its headquarters in Taiz. The Director of the Training Department and Coordinator of the Education Cluster at the Education Office- appreciated the interaction of BCFHD, mdf and the Executive Center for Mine Action for their efforts to implement the training course for the members of the Education Cluster. Noting that the education sector in Taiz Governorate is in great and urgent need to implement many interventions and programs activities,for it is one of the largest Yemeni governorates to enroll in education. (25) participants in The four days training. The training course, and it includes several main axes. The first day included the generalization of protection and risk analysis, while the second day included a child protection policy and a code of conduct, Sexual harassment and bullying. The third day includes an overview of mines, the awareness concept, their objectives and their types, in addition to identifying the types of mines, explosives, booby-traps and remnants of war, while the final day includes identifying the effects of mines and war remnants and ways to identify suspicious areas and their signs.

pages.title: The conclusion of the child protection and protection from mine training course for Education Cluster partners in Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: The conclusion of the child protection and protection from mine training course for Education Cluster partners in Taiz Today, Thursday, November 19, 2020, the training course in the field of...
pages.content: The conclusion of the child protection and protection from mine training course for Education Cluster partners in Taiz Today, Thursday, November 19, 2020, the training course in the field of “Child Protection and Protection from Mines” was concluded in Taiz City. The training is organized by the Education Cluster in coordination with BCFHD, mdf, and the Executive Center for Mine Action, which was held in the training hall at the building Charity “Taiz. The course, which lasted for four days, included Several main axes; protection mainstreaming, risk analysis, child protection policy, code of conduct, sexual harassment and bullying. The training course was attended by (25) participants representing several institutions (Partners of the Education Cluster). The training course presented and managed by the trainer “Naguib Sharaf” from the Ma’akum Development Foundation mdf. While the section of mine protection held by the trainer “Sanad Al-Yousifi” from the Executive Center for Mine Action in Taiz, included an overview of mines, the concept of awareness, their objectives and types, in addition to identifying the types of mines, devices, booby-traps and remnants of war, and identifying the effects of mines and war remnants, in addition to methods for identifying suspicious areas and their signs.

pages.title: BCFHD“concludes the distribution of student and teacher kits and hygiene kits. – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD“concludes the distribution of student and teacher kits and hygiene kits
pages.content: BCFHD“concludes the distribution of student and teacher kits and hygiene kits. Funded by YHF, BCFHD has concluded the distribution of students and a teachers’ kits in addition to schools’ hygiene kits within the project of ” Access to Education in Al Wazi’iyah” The project education Officer stated that these activities aim to create an appropriate educational environment in Al-Waziya District, encourage students to return to schools and relieve the financial burdens of their families. He added, “9345 school kits were distributed benefited (9345) students from first grade to sixth grade basic and In 32 schools in all sub-districts of Al Wazi’iyah.” In addition 525 teacher kits were distributed, of which (525) teachers benefited from all schools 1n the district. In terms of ​​hygiene, 23 cleaning kits were distributed targeting 23 schools for each targeted school. It is worth mentioning that the project included the restoration and rehabilitation of 25 schools, furnishing 9 schools with school seats with 557 double school seats, and installing 201 whiteboards with their accessories in 31 schools. The project also targeted training of 200 teachers on education in case of emergency and psychological support for students. In 32 schools in Al-Waziya District

pages.title: The  UN delegation visits the sites of projects implemented by “BCFHD” – BCFHD
pages.summary: The UN delegation visits the sites of projects implemented by “BCFHD” Within the field visits in Taiz, which are carried out by the UN delegation headed by Mr
pages.content: The UN delegation visits the sites of projects implemented by “BCFHD” Within the field visits in Taiz, which are carried out by the UN delegation headed by Mr. “Renee”, Director of the (UN- OCHA), Aden-Taiz, the delegation visited the sites of projects implemented by BCFHD and funded byYHF. In the visit, in which a team from BCFHD accompanied them to inform them of the nature of the implemented projects, the first destination was to“Ali bin Abi Talib School,” IDPs site in Al-Mudhaffar District, where the UN team met some of the beneficiaries and those responsible for managing the site and examined the impact of the project’s activities carried out by BCFHD in the Site, and to know their impression of the aids provided to them. Then the delegation went to the site of rehabilitating the sewage pumping station in Wadi Al Qadi – Al Mudhaffar District, where the project manager gave them an overview of the components of the project and the rehabilitation work that took place in it, indicating that the rehabilitation of the station targeting 50 thousand people after the station was completely stopped since 10. In the same context,the delegation went to the “She’ab Salit Well site” in Alqahirah District, which was rehabilitated and operated through the installation of a solar energy system. The delegation was briefed on the implemented work and conducted an interview with the specialists in the Water and Sanitation Corporation(LWSC), as it is the owner of the projects, as LWSC reported receiving the project from BCFHD, after completing its rehabilitation, praises BCFHD efforts in implementing this activity, which targiting about 25,000 people Al Misrakh district was the last destination for the visitins to see the project activities. They were briefed on the activity of installing a solar energy system to operate “Al Akdan” water project by solar system and targeting the area with home awareness campaigns that lasted 3 months that accompanied the rehabilitation activity. Interviews were made with some beneficiaries of the project to know their impression and the level of their satisfaction with the assistance provided and the coordination efforts that took place between BCFHD and the relevant authorities. For its part, the delegation praised the efforts made by BCFHD in delivering aid to vulnerable groups, and expressed their satisfaction with the implementation of projects through interviews conducted with the beneficiaries and the relevant authorities that praised the role of BCFHD in terms of effective coordination with it to ensure the achievement of tangible results of the projects in providing humanitarian aid to groups The vulnerable population of the IDPS and the host community in the targeted districts. It is worth mentioning that this visit was based on the coordination and follow-up of the projects implemented by BCFHD and funded by YHF.

pages.title: The women’s sector in (BCFHD) carries out various activities in the International Day for Women – BCFHD
pages.summary: The women’s sector in (BCFHD) carries out various activities in the International Day for Women An expanded meeting for women on the occasion of International Women’s Day (8th of March) has been...
pages.content: The women’s sector in (BCFHD) carries out various activities in the International Day for Women An expanded meeting for women on the occasion of International Women’s Day (8th of March) has been organized today in Bena Charity for Human Development BCFHD. The meeting has been attended by a number of high social status women and social active women in Taiz. Mrs. Tahani A Al-Ezzi- responsible for the women sector in the Charity- opened the meeting with greetings and congratulating Women in Yemen and all around the world on the occasion of the women International Day. She said that this event is organized as an acknowledgement, recognition and gratitude for women in Yemen who actively carried out different responsibilities including growing up children, worked hard in different fields to share men their families responsibilities and who play important roles side by side with men develop their society, and country. She expressed her warm regards, appreciation and respect to every woman who consciously participated in building cultural, educational and social aspects of life beside her main role of growing up healthy, qualified and prosperous generations that are able to face future difficulties and challenges. She also, called for strengthening woman’s role and protecting her, by empowering her and providing her with all capacities and skills that help her perform her roles in life including establishing a family and providing generations with knowledge and responsibility. Finally, she talked about the different challenges that face women in Yemen where they still fight for their basic rights specially during this difficult situation caused by civil conflict, Confirming that much effort, whether from the government or civil society organizations is needed to help women face and overcome such difficulties. During the meeting, women participants have discussed and shared ideas about some tops concerning women including; women’s rights and duties in society as a mother, and sister and the different opportunities and threats that encounter Arab women in general and Yemeni women in particular. The meeting come out with group of important recommendations.

pages.title: BCFHD distributes medicines and medical supplies to three hospitals in Taiz city – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD distributes medicines and medical supplies to three hospitals in Taiz city Funded by ECHO and with partnership of IRC, BCFHD distributed medicines and medical supplies (trauma kits) to...
pages.content: BCFHD distributes medicines and medical supplies to three hospitals in Taiz city Funded by ECHO and with partnership of IRC, BCFHD distributed medicines and medical supplies (trauma kits) to three hospitals in Taiz governorate within the project entitled “provide Emergency Medical Support to HFs in Conflict-affected areas in Salh and Maqbna districts”. The distribution was launched with the presence of key figures from Taiz local authority who praised the role of those who supported this project implementation, pointing to the importance of such medicines and medical supplies for hospitals. The Director of Health Office pointed out to the need of other conflict-affected areas’ health facilities for organizations’ support and the need to address all outstanding problems in these areas.

pages.title: KSrelief with BCFHD partnership inaugurates the distribution of food baskets. – BCFHD
pages.summary: KSrelief with BCFHD partnership inaugurates the distribution of food baskets
pages.content: KSrelief with BCFHD partnership inaugurates the distribution of food baskets. KSrelief, with partnership of BCFHD, inaugurated the project of distributing food baskets (FBs) during the month of Ramadan 2021 to number of Yemeni governorates. The distribution of food baskets will be carried out during the holy month of Ramadan in different governorates: Taiz, Aden, Marib, Shabwa, Hadramawt and Al-Mahra, in order to meet the needs of the most vulnerable HHs in these governorates. Abdulaziz Al Yousefi, the representative of BCFHD, stated that the inauguration included 9880 FBs, benefiting 9880 HHs in several governorates, of which 2,673 FBs will be distributed in Marib governorate. BCFHD and Ex.U Director General of Marib Governorate praised the continuous assistance of KSA represented by KSrelief.

pages.title: BCFHD provides relief to 200 displaced families affected by torrential rains and floods in Al-Shamaytayn. – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD provides relief to 200 displaced families affected by torrential rains and floods in Al-Shamaytayn
pages.content: BCFHD provides relief to 200 displaced families affected by torrential rains and floods in Al-Shamaytayn. Funded by “PURE HANDS”, BCFHD implemented the project of distributing food baskets for the flood-affected HHs in the IDP Sites in Al-Shamayatayn district, Taiz Governorate. Mr. Tariq Al-Hammadi, Executive Director of BCFHD, explained that this activity was an emergency response to the flood-affected IDPs in the targeted IDP sites of Al-Shamaytayn district. He added, “200 HHs were targeted with basic and necessary foodstuffs, and the implementation was carried out in coordination with the Sub-Cluster Food Security of Al-Turbah and Al Mukha districts, the Ex.U for the displaced, and in cooperation with CCCM.

pages.title: BCFHD concludes distributing 1,350 IPC kits in Mukha district, Taiz governorate – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD concludes distributing 1,350 IPC kits in Mukha district, Taiz governorate Funded by DRC, BCFHD has concluded the distribution of 1,350 IPC kits in Al Mukha District, Taiz Governorate
pages.content: BCFHD concludes distributing 1,350 IPC kits in Mukha district, Taiz governorate Funded by DRC, BCFHD has concluded the distribution of 1,350 IPC kits in Al Mukha District, Taiz Governorate. Abdulalem Aklan, the project officer, said that this kit contains washing, health and kitchen basic materials. He added that the distribution process was preceded by hygiene awareness campaigns aimed at raising the awareness of HHs about the good health practices. The distribution was carried out in two phases following precautionary measures to prevent targeted people from COVID-19 infection.

pages.title: BCFHD Inaugurates a food basket distribution project in Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD Inaugurates a food basket distribution project in Taiz Funded by KSrelief and with the presence of key figures from the local authority of Taiz Governorate, BCFHD launched the project of...
pages.content: BCFHD Inaugurates a food basket distribution project in Taiz Funded by KSrelief and with the presence of key figures from the local authority of Taiz Governorate, BCFHD launched the project of food baskets distribution of (119) tons for 11,000 IDPs, PwD and the most vulnerable HHs in the districts of Al-Mudhaffar, Al-Qahirah and Salh-Taiz city. Dr. AbdulKarem Shamsan, head of BCFHD, explained that this project is a continuation of food basket distribution project in the governorates of Al-Mahra, Hadramout, Marib, Shabwa and Aden, that was implemented last month by BCFHD. He also praised the KSrelief Center for this assistance which comes as a continuation to relieve the suffering of the Yemeni people who are seriously affected by the current civil conflict.

pages.title: BCFHD concludes distributing 500 fishing kits to HHs of fishermen in Al Mukha – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD concludes distributing 500 fishing kits to HHs of fishermen in Al Mukha Funded by YHF, BCFHD has concluded distributing fishing kits to 500 fishermen HHs in Al Mukha district
pages.content: BCFHD concludes distributing 500 fishing kits to HHs of fishermen in Al Mukha Funded by YHF, BCFHD has concluded distributing fishing kits to 500 fishermen HHs in Al Mukha district. This activity considers the second phase of the project; “improving livelihoods for fishermen HHs in Al Mukha district” where the first phase of the project was a three-consecutive rounds of cash assistance distributions. The targeted HHs were selected according to the criteria of FSAC, in coordination with the local authority and the community committee that represents the fishermen in Al Mukha district. Prior to the distribution, the beneficiaries were trained on the procedures for preserving the fishing kits.

pages.title: BCFHD launches the Spray fog campaign in the districts of Taiz city – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches the Spray fog campaign in the districts of Taiz city Funded by ECHO and in partnership with IRC, BCFHD launched the Spray fog campaign in cooperation with the Health Office as part...
pages.content: BCFHD launches the Spray fog campaign in the districts of Taiz city Funded by ECHO and in partnership with IRC, BCFHD launched the Spray fog campaign in cooperation with the Health Office as part of the project intitled: ” Emergency responses for epidemics of Cholera, COVID-19 and dengue fever in highly priority districts of Al Mudhaffar, Salh, Al Qahirah of Taiz Governorate”. Mutahar Al-Shamiri, the project manager, said that the campaign will last for 18 days, with 6 days in each district. He added that this activity is accompanied with a wide awareness campaign in the targeted districts to raise awareness of hygiene practices among families. The inauguration was attended by key figures from local authority. One of the attendees were Dr. Rajeh Al Maliki, Director of the Health Office, who praised the efforts made by the BCFHD in the health sector in Taiz.

pages.title: BCFHD launches the distribution of 2,200 HKs in the districts of Al Mudhaffar district – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches the distribution of 2,200 HKs in the districts of Al Mudhaffar district Funded by ECHO and in partnership with IRC, BCFHD inaugurated the distribution of 2,200 HKs in Al-Mudhaffar...
pages.content: BCFHD launches the distribution of 2,200 HKs in the districts of Al Mudhaffar district Funded by ECHO and in partnership with IRC, BCFHD inaugurated the distribution of 2,200 HKs in Al-Mudhaffar district, as part of the activities of the project “Emergency responses for epidemics of Cholera, COVID-19 and dengue fever in highly priority districts of Al Mudhaffar, Salh, Al Qahirah of Taiz Governorate”. Mutahar Al-Shamiri, the project manager, said that this activity is part of a series of activities as an emergency response to the most affected groups in the endemic and cholera-affected areas in the city. He added that the distribution was carried out under the precautionary measures to prevent COVID-19. He also added that the distribution will continue in the coming days for Al Mudhaffar and Salh districts.

pages.title: BCFHD distributes medicines, hygiene materials and oxygen tubes in the city of Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD distributes medicines, hygiene materials and oxygen tubes in the city of Taiz Funded by ECHO and in partnership with IRC, BCFHD distributed medicines, hygiene and personal protection...
pages.content: BCFHD distributes medicines, hygiene materials and oxygen tubes in the city of Taiz Funded by ECHO and in partnership with IRC, BCFHD distributed medicines, hygiene and personal protection materials to 13 health centres and hospitals in Taiz city within the framework of the project ” Emergency response for epidemics of Cholera, COVID-19 and dengue fever in highly priority districts of Al Mudhaffar, Salh, Al Qahirah of Taiz Governorate”. Dr. Sabreen Abdel-Wahab, the health facilitator in the project, said that the activity of distributing medicines and hygiene materials included 11 health centers in addition to Al-Jumhouri and Yemeni Swedish Hospitals. She added that this activity was preceded by the distribution of personal protective equipment (PPE) to Al-Jumhouri, Al-Thawra and Yemeni Swedish Hospitals besides to distributing 20 oxygen tubes to the last two mentioned Hospitals as part of the activities of this project.

pages.title: BCFHD launches the activity of distributing the fishing kits in Al Mukha district – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches the activity of distributing the fishing kits in Al Mukha district Funded by YHF, BCFHD inaugurated the distribution of fishing kits within the project of improving livelihoods for...
pages.content: BCFHD launches the activity of distributing the fishing kits in Al Mukha district Funded by YHF, BCFHD inaugurated the distribution of fishing kits within the project of improving livelihoods for fishermen’s HHs in Al Mukha district. Mr. Al-Sraji – Head of the Planning Committee of the Local Council of Al Mukha district, praised YHF and the efforts made by BCFHD for providing the fishing supplies to improving the livelihoods of fishermen, calling on all relevant organizations to carry out such empowerment projects for fishermen in the district. Suleiman Al-Samadi – the project officer – explained that this activity targets 500 HHs of fishermen, who were selected according to FSAC criteria, in coordination with the local authority and the community committee that represents the fishermen in the district. It is worth mentioning that the fishing kit distribution activity was preceded by a three-consecutive cash distribution for the targeted HHs.

pages.title: governor and in the presence of representatives of the relevant government offices. BCFHD handed over 25 schools after completing their restoration and rehabilitation – BCFHD
pages.summary: governor and in the presence of representatives of the relevant government offices
pages.content: governor and in the presence of representatives of the relevant government offices. BCFHD handed over 25 schools after completing their restoration and rehabilitation Within the project “improve access to education in the district of Al-Waziyiah” which was funded by YHF, BCFHD handed over 25 schools after completing their restoration and rehabilitation. The handover event was implemented under the auspices of the Governor of the Governorate, and it was attended by the Deputy Director of the Social Affairs and Labor Office and other representatives of the relevant government offices. Tariq Al-Hammadi, Executive Director of BCFHD, explained that the restoration and rehabilitation activity of schools is part of BCFHD’s efforts in the field of Education in order to create an appropriate learning environment for students, and motivate them to return to their schools. He added: the restoration activity targeted 25 of the worst-affected schools, which were identified in coordination with the local council and the Education Office of Al-Waziyiah district. It is worth mentioning that besides to the restoration activities, that this project included furnishing 9 schools with 557 double school seats, installing 201 modern blackboards with their supplies in 31 schools, distributing 9345 school bags with their supplies to students of both genders, and targeting 525 teachers with full-supplied teacher bags. In addition to distributing hygiene kits to 23 schools, the project also targeted training of 200 teachers on education in case of emergency and psychological support for students in 32 schools within the district.

pages.title: BCFHD concludes training 55 volunteers and 22 health workers in Taiz city – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD concludes training 55 volunteers and 22 health workers in Taiz city Funded by ECHO and in partnership with IRC, BCFHD has concluded the training of 55 volunteers and 22 health workers...
pages.content: BCFHD concludes training 55 volunteers and 22 health workers in Taiz city Funded by ECHO and in partnership with IRC, BCFHD has concluded the training of 55 volunteers and 22 health workers within the activities of the project “Emergency response for epidemics of Cholera, COVID-19 and dengue fever in highly priority districts of Al Mudhaffar, Salh, Al Qahirah of Taiz Governorate”. Mutahar Al-Shamiri, the project manager, said that 55 volunteers were trained to educate 17,000 beneficiaries in the three districts about the prevention of epidemics and viruses, adding that 22 health workers from the city’s hospitals were trained on how to act and take preventive measures when dealing with patients. The conclusion of the training course was attended by Dr. Rajeh Al-Maliky, Director of the Health Office in Taiz governorate, and he valued the efforts made by BCFHD to reduce the spread of epidemics in the governorate.

Mutahar Al-Shamiri, the project manager, said that 55 volunteers were trained to educate 17,000 beneficiaries in the three districts about the prevention of epidemics and viruses, adding that 22 health workers from the city’s hospitals were trained on how to act and take preventive measures when dealing with patients. The conclusion of the training course was attended by Dr. Rajeh Al-Maliky, Director of the Health Office in Taiz governorate, and he valued the efforts made by BCFHD to reduce the spread of epidemics in the governorate.

pages.title: BCFHD Concludes distributing more than 642 tons of food baskets in 6 governorates – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD Concludes distributing more than 642 tons of food baskets in 6 governorates Funded by KSrelief, BCFHD concluded the project of securing and distributing food baskets to needy families in...
pages.content: BCFHD Concludes distributing more than 642 tons of food baskets in 6 governorates Funded by KSrelief, BCFHD concluded the project of securing and distributing food baskets to needy families in six Yemeni governorates. Abdulkarem Shamsan, President of BCFHD, explained that the number of baskets that were distributed exceeded (642) tons of food containing the necessary items, which were received from the KSrelief through 19,761 food baskets, targeting the categories of the IDPs, families of orphans, people with special needs and the poorest HHs. He added: This project benefited (59,286 individuals), from (10,221 HHs) in 21 districts in the governorates of Marib, Shabwa, Hadramout, Al-Mahra, Taiz and Aden. The implementation of the project was carried out in coordination with the local authorities in each of the targeted governorates, where the targeted HHs were selected according to specific criteria that ensure the delivery of food to the neediest families, and the project was launched in the presence of representatives of the relevant government offices in each governorate. At the conclusion of his statement, Mr. Shamsan praised KSrelief for its financing of this project, noting that this aid comes as a continuation of the Kingdom’s humanitarian role to alleviate the suffering of the Yemeni people as a result of the current humanitarian crisis.

headings.text: BCFHD Concludes distributing more than 642 tons of food baskets in 6 governorates

paragraphs: Funded by KSrelief, BCFHD concluded the project of securing and distributing food baskets to needy families in six Yemeni governorates.

Abdulkarem Shamsan, President of BCFHD, explained that the number of baskets that were distributed exceeded (642) tons of food containing the necessary items, which were received from the KSrelief through 19,761 food baskets, targeting the categories of the IDPs, families of orphans, people with special needs and the poorest HHs.He added: This project benefited (59,286 individuals), from (10,221 HHs) in 21 districts in the governorates of Marib, Shabwa, Hadramout, Al-Mahra, Taiz and Aden.

The implementation of the project was carried out in coordination with the local authorities in each of the targeted governorates, where the targeted HHs were selected according to specific criteria that ensure the delivery of food to the neediest families, and the project was launched in the presence of representatives of the relevant government offices in each governorate.

At the conclusion of his statement, Mr. Shamsan praised KSrelief for its financing of this project, noting that this aid comes as a continuation of the Kingdom’s humanitarian role to alleviate the suffering of the Yemeni people as a result of the current humanitarian crisis.

pages.title: BCFHD launches the project of “Improved Access to Safe Education” in the presence of representatives of the local authority in Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches the project of “Improved Access to Safe Education” in the presence of representatives of the local authority in Taiz Funded by YHF, BCFHD launched the kick-off workshop for the...
pages.content: BCFHD launches the project of “Improved Access to Safe Education” in the presence of representatives of the local authority in Taiz Funded by YHF, BCFHD launched the kick-off workshop for the project “Improved Access to Safe Education” in Salah district. The workshop was attended by representatives from MoSAL, MoPIC and Education offices in Taiz Governorate. Zaid Hassan, the project manager, said that the project targets 5,294 male and female students, as well as 200 male and female teachers, in 13 schools in Salah District. He added: The project includes implementing training activities, distributing incentives for teachers from both genders, installing blackboards and solar energy systems, in addition to distributing hygiene kits in the targeted schools.

pages.title: BCFHD Receives the Delegation of the FAO – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD Receives the Delegation of the FAO Within the framework of evaluating the activities of the project “Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs in Ash Shamayatayn district” which is funded...
pages.content: BCFHD Receives the Delegation of the FAO Within the framework of evaluating the activities of the project “Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs in Ash Shamayatayn district” which is funded by FAO, BCFHD received the delegation of FAO at the BCFHD’s branch in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate. During the two-day visit, the visiting delegation met with the Farmers Field Schools training team to give them the necessary instructions for the training as well as visiting agricultural fields to assess the viability and safety of the distributed seeds and their suitability to the agricultural environment in the district. It is worth noting that this project targets 2,750 HHs in different subdistricts in Al-Shamayatayn district and it was inaugurated in July 2020, and it includes many agricultural and animal activities, most notably training on correct agricultural practices, training farmers on the fattening process for small animals and cows, the distribution of agricultural and animal inputs, and the distribution of equipment for the manufacture of cheese and dairy products.

headings.text: BCFHD Receives the Delegation of the FAO

paragraphs: Within the framework of evaluating the activities of the project “Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs in Ash Shamayatayn district” which is funded by FAO, BCFHD received the delegation of FAO at the BCFHD’s branch in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate.

During the two-day visit, the visiting delegation met with the Farmers Field Schools training team to give them the necessary instructions for the training as well as visiting agricultural fields to assess the viability and safety of the distributed seeds and their suitability to the agricultural environment in the district.

It is worth noting that this project targets 2,750 HHs in different subdistricts in Al-Shamayatayn district and it was inaugurated in July 2020, and it includes many agricultural and animal activities, most notably training on correct agricultural practices, training farmers on the fattening process for small animals and cows, the distribution of agricultural and animal inputs, and the distribution of equipment for the manufacture of cheese and dairy products.

pages.title: BCFHD implements the kick-off workshop for the CCCM and Shelter Management Project – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD implements the kick-off workshop for the CCCM and Shelter Management Project Funded by YHF, BCFHD carried out the kick-off workshop for the project intitled “Management and coordination of...
pages.content: BCFHD implements the kick-off workshop for the CCCM and Shelter Management Project Funded by YHF, BCFHD carried out the kick-off workshop for the project intitled “Management and coordination of IDP hosting Sites and improving living conditions and access to assistance for the most vulnerable IDPs in Salh district and providing emergency and life-saving assistance to the most acutely vulnerable and host communities in Maqbanah District” in Taiz Governorate, The workshop was attended by the Office Directors of MoSAL, and the Executive Unit for the Displaced in Taiz Governorate in addition to the directors of Salh and Maqbanah districts. The project targets more than 17,000 individuals in Salh and Maqbanah Districts through the provision of integrated response assistance in IDP hosting sites to enhance the safety of IDPs and preserve their dignity. In addition to improving living conditions and access to assistance for vulnerable HHs (people with disabilities, marginalized groups, and people with special needs). The workshop was also attended by representatives of the marginalized and disabled groups, the representative of the Women and Child Center, as well as BCFHD’s work team.

pages.title: BCFHD distributes dairy production equipment in Al-Shamayatayn – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD distributes dairy production equipment in Al-Shamayatayn Funded by FAO and within the activities of the project of “Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs with livelihoods and food...
pages.content: BCFHD distributes dairy production equipment in Al-Shamayatayn Funded by FAO and within the activities of the project of “Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs with livelihoods and food security in Al-Shamayatayn district”, BCFHD distributed dairy production equipment to 243 HHs. Faisal Al-Sabri – the project manager – said that the distributed equipment contained many tools for dairy production, most notably refrigerators, ice preserves, cheese cooking stoves, metal tools for preserving and storing milk, and many other tools for dairy production and cheese industry. He added that this distribution was preceded by educating the beneficiaries and the distribution team was provided with the required instructions to implement this activity

pages.title: BCFHD launches the Project of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WaSH) in Taiz Governorate – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches the Project of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WaSH) in Taiz Governorate Funded by YHF, and within the framework of priority No
pages.content: BCFHD launches the Project of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WaSH) in Taiz Governorate Funded by YHF, and within the framework of priority No. 3, BCFHD launched the project of ” Provision of comprehensive emergency and life-saving WASH assistance to the most vulnerable IDPs and host communities in Salh and Al-Mudhaffar districts in Taizz city) through the kick-off workshop of the project. The workshop was attended by 20 participants, headed by the Office Directors of MoSAL, GHO, LWSC and the Executive Unit for the Displaced in Taiz Governorate. Mutahar Al-Shamiri, the project manager, explained that this project targets 173,000 people in the districts of Salh and Mudhaffar in Taiz governorate. He added: the project targets many activities, including providing drinking water and monitoring water quality to 91 distribution points, Purchasing and installing water tanks, and maintaining and chlorination of 30 wells feeding water networks in the targeted districts. He continued, In the field of sanitation and hygiene promotion; two main open sewage lines will be rehabilitated and connected to the nearest sanitation networks, and the blocked manholes will be cleaned and opened, in addition to the implementation of sweeping campaigns in the IDP sites. The project will also implement the training of community volunteers on hygiene promotion messages, implement mass campaigns on epidemic control and prevention, in addition to distributing consumble hygiene kits (CHKs) and basic hygiene kits (BHKs). Al-Shamiri confirmed that after the implementation of the activities, the projects will be handed over to the local authority in order to ensure their continuity, preservation and maintenance through close coordination from LWSC. The workshop was also attended by the Deputy Director of the Cleaning and Improvement Fund in Taiz, representatives of the targeted districts (Salah and Mudhaffar), as well as the project team of the organization

pages.summary: BCFHD caries out a training workshop for the awareness team in the project of Access to Safe education Within the project of Improve Access to Safe Education in Salh district, which is Funded by...
pages.content: BCFHD caries out a training workshop for the awareness team in the project of Access to Safe education Within the project of Improve Access to Safe Education in Salh district, which is Funded by YHF, BCFHD held a training workshop for the awareness and distribution team where the team was introduced to the activities and objectives of the project, and details of the tasks that they will carry out. The team was also trained on education in emergency situations, and they were briefed on the child protection policy, and many topics related to awareness and distribution. It is worth noting that the project’s activities target 5,294 students from both genders, and 200 male and female teachers in 13 schools in Salh District, Taiz Governorate.

pages.title: BCFHD distributes 200 school bags in Salh District – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD distributes 200 school bags in Salh District Funded by Pure Hands Organization, BCFHD carried out the distribution of 200 school bags with their supplies, in the presence of Faisal...
pages.content: BCFHD distributes 200 school bags in Salh District Funded by Pure Hands Organization, BCFHD carried out the distribution of 200 school bags with their supplies, in the presence of Faisal Al-Sabri, the education cluster coordinator in south of Taiz, and Muhammad Abdo Hassan, director of the Education Office in Salh District. Mr. Hassan indicated that such initiatives reflect the spirit of social responsibility towards education, and demonstrate the role of partnership with organizations and their contributions in supporting educational goals. For his part, Abdel-Alam Aqlan – the education officer in BCFHD – explained that this activity was implemented in coordination with Cluster Education, and targeted 200 displaced and marginalized students from the first to the third grade in two schools in Salh District with school bags and supplies. He added: Our aim by distributing the school bag is to encourage students to return to school and reduce the financial burdens on the students’ families, in light of the difficult economic conditions they are going through.

pages.title: BCFHD launches the Clothing distribution project in Marib – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches the Clothing distribution project in Marib Funded by KSrelief, BCFHD inaugurated, in Marib Governorate, the project of Distributing Clothes for Women and Girls in the Republic of Yemen
pages.content: BCFHD launches the Clothing distribution project in Marib Funded by KSrelief, BCFHD inaugurated, in Marib Governorate, the project of Distributing Clothes for Women and Girls in the Republic of Yemen. The inauguration was headed by the undersecretary of Marib Governorate and attended by Abdul Rahman Al-Saiari, branch manager of KSrelief and other key representatives from local authorities and BCFHD. In this distribution, 140 pieces of clothing were distributed, benefiting 70 women and girls in Istanbul Camp and the displaced HHs close to the Camp. It is worth noting that the project aims to distribute (42,510) pieces of clothing for women and girls in the governorates of Aden and Marib, as part of the humanitarian efforts of KSrelief to assist and support the most vulnerable groups in the republic.

pages.title: BCFHD Concludes Distribution of Dairy Equipment in Al-Shamayatayn District – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD Concludes Distribution of Dairy Equipment in Al-Shamayatayn District Funded by FAO, BCFHD has concluded the distribution of dairy equipment to 242 HHs within the activities of the Project...
pages.content: BCFHD Concludes Distribution of Dairy Equipment in Al-Shamayatayn District Funded by FAO, BCFHD has concluded the distribution of dairy equipment to 242 HHs within the activities of the Project Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs in the field of agricultural livelihoods in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate. Faisal Al-Sabri, the project manager, said that three types of dairy equipment were distributed. The first type was in the form of individual equipment, benefiting 162 HHs, and the second type was equipment for small groups, benefiting 60 HHs while the third type contains large equipment distributed into two leading groups, where the group contains 10 HHs. He added: The distribution continued for five days under the precautionary measures against Corona virus.

headings.text: BCFHD Concludes Distribution of Dairy Equipment in Al-Shamayatayn District

paragraphs: Funded by FAO, BCFHD has concluded the distribution of dairy equipment to 242 HHs within the activities of the Project Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs in the field of agricultural livelihoods in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate.

Faisal Al-Sabri, the project manager, said that three types of dairy equipment were distributed. The first type was in the form of individual equipment, benefiting 162 HHs, and the second type was equipment for small groups, benefiting 60 HHs while the third type contains large equipment distributed into two leading groups, where the group contains 10 HHs.
He added: The distribution continued for five days under the precautionary measures against Corona virus.

pages.title: BCFHD continues to distribute health kits to the IDPs in Al-Ma’afer and Al-Shamayatayn Districts in Taiz Governorate – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD continues to distribute health kits to the IDPs in Al-Ma’afer and Al-Shamayatayn Districts in Taiz Governorate Funded by IRC, BCFHD continues to distribute health kits to the IDPs within...
pages.content: BCFHD continues to distribute health kits to the IDPs in Al-Ma’afer and Al-Shamayatayn Districts in Taiz Governorate Funded by IRC, BCFHD continues to distribute health kits to the IDPs within the Emergency Response Project for those affected by the floods in the IDP Sites in Al-Ma’afer and Al-Shamayatayn districts in Taiz governorate. The distribution targets 900 vulnerable HHs from 7 different IDP Sites (2 in Al-Ma’afer District with 308 HHs and 5 IDP Sites in Al-Shamayatayn District with 246 HHs). It is worth mentioning that the distribution activity was preceded by a training workshop for the verification and awareness team where they were introduced to the methods used in the verification process of the targeted HHs. They were also trained on the awareness mechanism and what awareness messages will be delivered to the beneficiaries in the targeted IDP Sites and the HHs living nearby.

pages.title: BCFHD participates in the 2021 Food Security and Livelihoods assessment (FSLA) Training of Trainers (TOT) workshop – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD participates in the 2021 Food Security and Livelihoods assessment (FSLA) Training of Trainers (TOT) workshop BCFHD, represented by Riadh Shamsan – the Director of the Food Security Program...
pages.content: BCFHD participates in the 2021 Food Security and Livelihoods assessment (FSLA) Training of Trainers (TOT) workshop BCFHD, represented by Riadh Shamsan – the Director of the Food Security Program in the ORG, participated in the “2021 FSLA Training of Trainers workshop” during the period 12-16 September in Aden GOV. This workshop was organized by WFP, MoPIC, Ministry of Agriculture and Irrigation and the Central Statistics Organization and in partnership with FAO and UNCEF. The course aimed to provide the trainers with the skills of collecting information about the situation of food security of HHs and providing future assistance in surveying and livelihoods, and knowledge about the survey process and the necessary needs for food security and livelihoods. The course included theoretical and practical sessions on measuring and defining the regulations of the survey process to reach positive and real results regarding the actual needs of cases of malnutrition and to understand people’s need for livelihoods and improving their living conditions in the future. The course was attended by 30 participants from the government, local and international organizations, and relevant authorities.
