pages.content: BCFHD holds a meeting with the local authority offices in Taiz Within the projects of “WaSH” and “Shelter & CCCM” which are funded by YHF, BCFHD held a meeting with the directors of the local authority offices in Taiz governorate; MoPIC, MoSAL, LWSC, CF and EX.U. to discuss the coordination and implementation mechanism of the activities for each project. In the meeting, the manager of both projects, reviewed the tasks and the activities related to the two projects. He also answered the inquiries of the attendees. pages.title: BCFHD launches a clothing distribution project in Aden – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches a clothing distribution project in Aden Funded by KSrelief, BCFHD inaugurated the “Project for distributing clothes for women and girls in the Republic of Yemen” in Aden
pages.content: BCFHD launches a clothing distribution project in Aden Funded by KSrelief, BCFHD inaugurated the “Project for distributing clothes for women and girls in the Republic of Yemen” in Aden. At the inauguration, 850 pieces of clothing were distributed benefiting 600 women and girls in the targeted areas. The inauguration was attended by prominent figures from the local authority, in addition to the representatives of KSrelief. It is worth noting that the project aims to distribute (42,510) pieces of clothing for women and girls in the governorates of Aden and Marib, as part of the humanitarian efforts of KSrelief to assist and support the most vulnerable groups in the republic of Yemen.

pages.title: BCFHD holds the first meeting of the community committees of the WaSH project – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD holds the first meeting of the community committees of the WaSH project Funded by YHF, BCFHD held the first meeting of community committees within the activities of the project to provide...
pages.content: BCFHD holds the first meeting of the community committees of the WaSH project Funded by YHF, BCFHD held the first meeting of community committees within the activities of the project to provide emergency aid in Water, Sanitation and Hygiene Promotion Sector (WaSH) for the displaced and the most vulnerable host communities affected by the risk of displacement in the districts of Salh and Al Mudhafar. In this meeting, the tasks of the community committees were clarified, as well as introducing them to the project activities and the targeted areas. The community committees’ inquiries were answered and they were introduced to the mechanism of complaints and suggestions. It is worth noting that the community committee has 30 members, 10 of whom are representatives from the executive unit in the governorate.

pages.title: The Director of the Education Office in Taiz inaugurates the training program of 200 teachers in Salh District – BCFHD
pages.summary: The Director of the Education Office in Taiz inaugurates the training program of 200 teachers in Salh District Within the activities of the project “Improving access to safe education” which is...
pages.content: The Director of the Education Office in Taiz inaugurates the training program of 200 teachers in Salh District Within the activities of the project “Improving access to safe education” which is funded by YHF and implemented by BCFHD, Mr. Abdul-Waseh Shaddad, Director General of Education Office in Taiz Governorate, has inaugurated the training program of 200 volunteer teachers in Salh District. In his speech, Mr. Shaddad stressed the importance of this program as it meets the teacher’s need in acquiring learning methods and psychological support for students in the light of the current circumstances in the country. He also praised the efforts made by both the funder YHF, and the IP BCFHD in the educational aspect. In the same context, Abdulaleem Aqlan, the Project Officer said that the training will take place within 8 days targeting 200 volunteer teachers (170 female and 30 male ) who were selected according to specific criteria from 13 schools, with the approval of the Education Office in the district and in coordination with the Education Office in the governorate. He added that the training includes education in case of emergency, active learning, accelerated education, protection from Covid 19, and safe school protocols, indicating that the teachers will acquire skills and modern education methods and methods of psychological support in case of emergency, which will have a great impact in improving the level of students’ learning. It is worth mentioning that the inauguration was attended by the Head of BCFHD, the Executive Director and a number of project employees.

pages.title: BCFHD “trains 242 HHs benefiting from dairy equipment in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD “trains 242 HHs benefiting from dairy equipment in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate Funded by FAO, BCFHD continues the training of 242 women benefiting from dairy equipment that...
pages.content: BCFHD “trains 242 HHs benefiting from dairy equipment in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate Funded by FAO, BCFHD continues the training of 242 women benefiting from dairy equipment that was distributed last September within the activities of the project of “Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs in the field of agricultural livelihoods” which targets 2,750 HHs in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate. The targeted HHs are trained to use the distributed equipment which were divided into three sections: 1- Individual equipment that benefited 162 HHs. 2- Equipment for small groups, benefiting 60 HHs. 3- large equipment distributed into two leading groups, where the group contains 10 HHs. It is worth noting that the project includes many agricultural and animal activities, most notably training on the proper agricultural practices, training farmers on the fattening process for small animals and cows, distributing agricultural and animal inputs, and distributing equipment for the manufacture of cheese and dairy products.

pages.title: BCFHD launches FFS training in Al-Shamayatayn District – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches FFS training in Al-Shamayatayn District Funded by FAO, BCFHD launched the activity of FFS training for fattening animals and producing dairy products within the project of...
pages.content: BCFHD launches FFS training in Al-Shamayatayn District Funded by FAO, BCFHD launched the activity of FFS training for fattening animals and producing dairy products within the project of “Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs in the field of agricultural livelihoods and food security” in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate. Dr. Faisal Al-Sabri, the project manager, explained that the training targets 175 male and female trainees in 7 FFS. He added that there will be 12 training sessions for 3 months in experimental and traditional FFS, so that the sharing of experiences will take place among the trainees to reach the improvement of fattening animals and increasing the production of dairy products. He continued, targeted FFS in dairy products are trained in how to manufacture different types of diary productions, while fattening FFS is directed at how to fatten small and large animals. He pointed out that this training will be followed by another FFS training for 3 schools for tomato production targeting 75 male and female trainees, and 3 other training programs were implemented for cereal production benefited 75 male and female trainees. It is worth mentioning that the training activity for all FFS was preceded by the distribution of materials and equipment for each FFS for all 325 male and female trainees

pages.title: BCFHD concludes the training of 200 volunteer teachers in Salh District – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD concludes the training of 200 volunteer teachers in Salh District Funded by YHF, BCFHD has concluded the training of 200 volunteer teachers in Salh District, Taiz Governorate, within the...
pages.content: BCFHD concludes the training of 200 volunteer teachers in Salh District Funded by YHF, BCFHD has concluded the training of 200 volunteer teachers in Salh District, Taiz Governorate, within the activities of the project “Improving access to safe education”. Dr. Abdulkarem Shamsan, President of BCFHD, expressed his happiness at the conclusion of the training activity, and congratulated the volunteer teachers for this achievement, and urged them to apply what they took during the training program, thanking the project team and trainers who made efforts in the training process and the success of the program. Zaid Al-Amery, the project manager, indicated that this activity is part of a number of activities targeting 5294 male and female students, and 200 male and female volunteer teachers in 13 schools in Salh District, Taiz Governorate, indicating that the trained teachers have acquired skills and modern teaching methods in case of emergency, which will have an impact in improving the level of learning for students and providing them with knowledge and information of using modern and advanced scientific methods. In this regard, Mr. Ali Al-Kamali, one of the trainers, praised BCFHD for this training program as it resulted in these trained volunteer teachers filled a large gap in the educational field. He explained that the program focused on four training packages, Education in Case of Emergency, Active and Accelerated Learning, Protection from Covid 19, and Safe School Protocols, where the trainees were divided into 8 groups. he also expressed his admiration on the well-preparation of the program. In the other hand, the trainees, thanked BCFHD for this generosity towards volunteer teachers, as it is the only organization that has worked in the field of training volunteer teachers, they pointed out that “We often use the word building on the basis of construction, and what many people do not know is that the real and optimal building is for the human being.” At the conclusion of the training course, the project team distributed certificates of participation to the targeted teachers.

pages.content: BCFHD distributes water tanks to IDP Sites in Salh and Al-Mudhaffar districts Funded by YHF, BCFHD has delivered 8 water tanks with a capacity of 1500 Liters to the IDP Sites in the districts of Salh and Al-Mudhaffar as a part of the activities of the project of “Providing emergency aid in WASH sector for the most vulnerable IDPs and host communities affected by the risk of displacement”, to benefit 315 HHs. The water tanks were delivered to the community committees of each targeted area, which were previously nominated by the local community. It is worth noting that these tanks will be filled with drinking water on a daily basis for three consecutive months, within 91 water points targeting thousands of the most vulnerable HH in Salh and Al-Mudhaffar districts in Taiz governorate.

pages.content: Monthly Briefing News of BCFHD – October 2021 BCFHD continues the distribution project of 42,510 pieces of clothing for women and girls in the IDP Sites in Marib and Aden Governorate, which is funded by KSrelief Center. BCFHD holds the kick-off workshop for the project of “Teach her Technology to Promote Peace”, for female students of scientific colleges which funded by the Cultural Exchange Program at the US Embassy in Yemen. BCFHD caries out the first coordination meeting of the community committees for the Shelter/CCCM YHF-funded project which targets 15,000 individuals in Salh district, and 2,100 HHs in Salh and Maqbnah districts in Taiz Governorate. BCFHD implements the first coordination meeting of the community committees Within the YHF-funded Project of WASH, which targets 173,000 individuals in the districts of Salh and Al-Mudhaffar in Taiz governorate. BCFHD launches FFS training in Al-Shamayatayn district, which targets 175 male and female trainees in 7 FFS, as part of the activities of the project of “Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs in the field of agricultural livelihoods in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate” which funded by FAO. BCFHD trains 242 HHs benefiting from dairy equipment in Al-Shamayatayn district within the activities of the project “Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs in the field of agricultural livelihoods in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate” which funded by FAO. BCFHD trains 200 male and female volunteer teachers in 13 schools within the activities of the project “Improving access to safe education in Salh district, Taiz governorate” which funded by YHF. pages.title: BCFHD launches training of community volunteers on community awareness – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches training of community volunteers on community awareness Funded by the YHF, BCFHD, launched a training course on Sunday, November 7, 2021for Community Volunteers on community...
pages.content: BCFHD launches training of community volunteers on community awareness Funded by the YHF, BCFHD, launched a training course on Sunday, November 7, 2021for Community Volunteers on community awareness within the activities of the project entitled; “Provision of comprehensive emergency and life-saving WASH assistance to the most acutely vulnerable IDPs and host communities most at risk due to recent displacements and conflict in high priority districts (Salh and Al-Mudhaffar districts in Taizz city) – Under priority 3”. The course targets 26 male and female volunteers for 3 days and it involves many topics, the most important of which are the mechanisms of community awareness, the causes and prevention procedures of cholera and COVID, in addition to general health concepts.

headings.text: BCFHD launches training of community volunteers on community awareness

paragraphs: Funded by the YHF, BCFHD, launched a training course on Sunday, November 7, 2021for Community Volunteers on community awareness within the activities of the project entitled; “Provision of comprehensive emergency and life-saving WASH assistance to the most acutely vulnerable IDPs and host communities most at risk due to recent displacements and conflict in high priority districts (Salh and Al-Mudhaffar districts in Taizz city) – Under priority 3”.

The course targets 26 male and female volunteers for 3 days and it involves many topics, the most important of which are the mechanisms of community awareness, the causes and prevention procedures of cholera and COVID, in addition to general health concepts.

pages.title: BCFHD distributes tomato production inputs to 100 farmers in Ash-Shamayatayn District – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD distributes tomato production inputs to 100 farmers in Ash-Shamayatayn District Funded by FAO, BCFHD inaugurated the distribution of tomato seeds to farmers in Al-Safia sub district, as...
pages.content: BCFHD distributes tomato production inputs to 100 farmers in Ash-Shamayatayn District Funded by FAO, BCFHD inaugurated the distribution of tomato seeds to farmers in Al-Safia sub district, as part of the project of “Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs in the field of agricultural livelihoods and food security” in Ash-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate. The distribution of tomato seeds targeted 100 tomato producers, in addition to distributing 5 irrigation networks, which will be followed later by the distribution of fertilizers, traps, 3 tubes of Pheromone and two bottles of Neem for each beneficiary. The activity will conclude with training 75 beneficiaries who will be selected from the 100 within three FFS, in which the trainees will receive scientific and practical expertise that qualifies them to grow tomatoes according to modern methods which will help increase production and marketing of tomatoes, in order to increase the income for productive HHs in a way that enhances the resilience of those HHs.

pages.summary: Launching a project to distribute clothes to displaced women in three districts of Taiz governorate Within the project of “Distributing clothes for women and girls in the Republic of Yemen”,...
pages.content: Launching a project to distribute clothes to displaced women in three districts of Taiz governorate Within the project of “Distributing clothes for women and girls in the Republic of Yemen”, which is implemented by BCFHD and funded by KSrelief, Deputy Director of SAL Office in Taiz, Inaugurated the distribution of clothes to displaced women in Al-Arous area of ​​ Saber Al-Mawadim District, The project aims to distribute 8,000 pieces of clothing to 4,000 displaced women and girls in the districts of Sabr Al Muwadim, Salh and Ash Shamayatayn in Taiz Governorate. The inauguration was attended by key figures from local authorities and from BCFHD.

pages.title: BCFHD concludes the training of 60 volunteers in the field of CCCM – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD concludes the training of 60 volunteers in the field of CCCM Funded by YHF, BCFHD has concluded the training of 60 volunteers in the field of CCCM in the districts of Taiz city, within the...
pages.content: BCFHD concludes the training of 60 volunteers in the field of CCCM Funded by YHF, BCFHD has concluded the training of 60 volunteers in the field of CCCM in the districts of Taiz city, within the activities of CCCM and Shelter project. The training targeted 10 focal points for IDP sites and representatives of the Executive Unit of IDPs, as well as 20 individuals representing community committees in IDP sites during 4 consecutive days. The training also included 10 volunteers in terms of activating the complaints mechanism and responding to it, in addition to 10 who were trained to conduct multi-sectoral site surveys, and 10 others who were trained on the monitoring process for the movement of IDPs in the sites.

pages.title: BCFHD implements the kick-off workshop for the project of Using Technology for female students of scientific faculties – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD implements the kick-off workshop for the project of Using Technology for female students of scientific faculties Today, Thursday, October 7, 2021, BCFHD launched the kick-off workshop of...
pages.content: BCFHD implements the kick-off workshop for the project of Using Technology for female students of scientific faculties Today, Thursday, October 7, 2021, BCFHD launched the kick-off workshop of the project intitled “Teach her Technology to Promote Peace” which is funded by the Cultural Exchange Program at the US Embassy in Yemen. Riyadh Shamsan, the project manager, explained that the main objective of this project is to improve self-learning skills for the purposes of study and academic research using Internet-equipped labs in order to access additional scientific resources, in addition, the project will enhance the role of women in peace building by using technology. He added, The project targets 180 female students from science colleges in Aden and Abyan governorates, in coordination with local authorities and the administration of the targeted colleges. The workshop was attended by the President of BCFHD, Executive Director, representative of women’s sector and the protection officer, in addition to the project team.

pages.title: BCFHD receives a delegation from the Save the Children Organization – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD receives a delegation from the Save the Children Organization Dr Abdulkarem Shamsan, President of BCFHD and Mr
pages.content: BCFHD receives a delegation from the Save the Children Organization Dr. Abdulkarem Shamsan, President of BCFHD and Mr. Tariq Al-Hammadi, the Executive Director, received a delegation from “Save the Children” Organization. In the meeting, the two parties discussed ways to develop partnership and strengthen the relationship in areas of mutual interest. They also discussed issues of common interest and stressed on the cooperation between the two organizations. The delegation of Save the Children Organization expressed its happiness with this meeting, stressing its keenness to promote cooperation and coordination between the two organizations.

pages.title: BCFHD Monthly Briefing – November 2021 – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD Monthly Briefing – November 2021 – BCFHD distributes 8 water tanks with a capacity of 1500 liters to the IDP sites in Salh and Al-Mudhaffar districts
pages.content: BCFHD Monthly Briefing – November 2021 – BCFHD distributes 8 water tanks with a capacity of 1500 liters to the IDP sites in Salh and Al-Mudhaffar districts. These tanks are among 91 water-distribution points, will be filled daily with drinking water within the next 3 months. – BCFHD distributes tomato production inputs to 100 farmers, in addition to distributing 5 irrigation networks, as part of the project of “Supporting the Resilience of Vulnerable HHs” in the field of agricultural livelihoods and food security in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate. – BCFHD trained 26 volunteers on community awareness and health education within the activities of the WASH Project in the districts of Salh and Mudhaffar in Taiz Governorate. – Four thousand displaced women and girls benefited from the “Clothes Distribution” Project in the districts of Sabir Al-Muwadim, Salh, and Al Shamayatayn in Taiz Governorate. – BCFHD trained 60 volunteers in the field of Shelter and CCCM within the project implemented in the districts of Salh and Maqbna in Taiz governorate. Preparations for the training of 180 female students from the scientific faculties of the Universities of Aden and Abyan on scientific research using technology within the project “Engage her with Technology to Promote Peace”, after completing coordination with the relevant authorities. – BCFHD distributed 142 psychological support kits for students, and 60 hygiene kits for male and female teachers at Al-Amal Center for the Disabled Rehabilitation. – BCFHD disburses the second round of cash incentives to volunteer teachers who were previously included in a training program, targeting 170 female teachers and 30 male teachers in 13 schools, as part of the activities of the project of “Improving Access to Safe Education” implemented in Salh district.

Preparations for the training of 180 female students from the scientific faculties of the Universities of Aden and Abyan on scientific research using technology within the project “Engage her with Technology to Promote Peace”, after completing coordination with the relevant authorities. – BCFHD distributed 142 psychological support kits for students, and 60 hygiene kits for male and female teachers at Al-Amal Center for the Disabled Rehabilitation. – BCFHD disburses the second round of cash incentives to volunteer teachers who were previously included in a training program, targeting 170 female teachers and 30 male teachers in 13 schools, as part of the activities of the project of “Improving Access to Safe Education” implemented in Salh district.

pages.title: BCFHD launches the distribution of Basic and Consumable hygiene Kits in the districts of Salh and Al-Mudhaffar – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches the distribution of Basic and Consumable hygiene Kits in the districts of Salh and Al-Mudhaffar Funded by YHF BCFHD inaugurated the distribution of basic and consumable hygiene...
pages.content: BCFHD launches the distribution of Basic and Consumable hygiene Kits in the districts of Salh and Al-Mudhaffar Funded by YHF BCFHD inaugurated the distribution of basic and consumable hygiene kits (BHKs & CHKs) within the project of “Providing Emergency Assistance in WASH Sector” for the most vulnerable HHs in Salh and Al-Mudhaffar Districts. During the first day, 392 HHs were provided with both BHKs and CHKs. The project aims to distribute 4,000 hygiene kits to 4,000 HHs, which were selected in coordination with the Public Health and Population Office in Taiz Governorate, after ensuring that they conform to the selection criteria

pages.title: BCFHD launches sewage cleaning campaigns in Taiz Governorate – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches sewage cleaning campaigns in Taiz Governorate Within the YHF-Funded WASH project, BCFHD launched the sewage cleaning campaign to clean and open blocked sewage manholes in the...
pages.content: BCFHD launches sewage cleaning campaigns in Taiz Governorate Within the YHF-Funded WASH project, BCFHD launched the sewage cleaning campaign to clean and open blocked sewage manholes in the districts of Salh and Al-Mudhaffar, in addition to rehabilitating some sewage lines into the public sewage network to ensure that sewage does not flow into streets and residential areas in order to obtain safe health areas. On the other hand, Mr. Fouad Abdullah, Deputy Director of SAL, praised the efforts of BCFHD for its activities and projects. It is worth noting that the implementation of this activity is carried out through the cash-for-work mechanism by the workers of the LWSC in the districts of Salh and Al-Mudhaffar, and it continues for a period of 6 months.
pages.search_text: BCFHD launches sewage cleaning campaigns in Taiz Governorate Within the YHF-Funded WASH project, BCFHD launched the sewage cleaning campaign to clean and open blocked sewage manholes in the districts of Salh and Al-Mudhaffar, in addition to rehabilitating some sewage lines into the public sewage network to ensure that sewage does not flow into streets and residential areas in order to obtain safe health areas. Al-Hammadi said: The campaigns to sweep garbage in the city will be carried out daily for a period of 3 months, in coordination with the Cleaning Fund in Taiz. He added: This activity comes one day after the inauguration of the activity of “Cleaning Manholes and rehabilitation of sewage” in Salh and Al-Mudhaffar Districts, noting that there are many other activities within WASH project that BCFHD will implement later in coordination relevant authorities. The project manager, Mutahar Al-Shamiri, explained that the garbage sweeping activity is implemented through the cash-for-work mechanism by 420 of fund’s workers and field observers who were selected according to the selection criteria where BCFHD supports them with cash incentives, sweeping tools and cleaning materials during the project period.

pages.title: BCFHD disburses the third batch of cash incentives to volunteer teachers in Salh District December 21, 2021 – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD disburses the third batch of cash incentives to volunteer teachers in Salh District December 21, 2021 Coinciding with the start of the second semester 2022-2021, BCFHD began to disburse...
pages.content: BCFHD disburses the third batch of cash incentives to volunteer teachers in Salh District December 21, 2021 Coinciding with the start of the second semester 2022-2021, BCFHD began to disburse cash incentives to 200 male and female volunteer teachers in Salh District, Taiz Governorate, as part of the activities of the YHF-Funded project “Improving Access to Safe Education”. This is the third batch of 6 monthly payments for volunteers who were previously targeted by the “Education in Emergency Training Program”, targeting 170 female teachers and 30 male teachers in 13 schools in the district.

pages.title: BCFHD inaugurates an exhibition of dairy products in Al-Turbah sub district of Ash Shamayatayn district – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD inaugurates an exhibition of dairy products in Al-Turbah sub district of Ash Shamayatayn district Within the project of “Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs in the field of...
pages.content: BCFHD inaugurates an exhibition of dairy products in Al-Turbah sub district of Ash Shamayatayn district Within the project of “Supporting the resilience of vulnerable HHs in the field of agricultural livelihoods and food security” in the Ash Shamayatayn District, Taiz Governorate which is funded by FAO, BCFHD inaugurated the exhibition of dairy products in Al-Turbah sub district in the presence of the director of the district, head of the local council and other key figures from local authority. The representatives of local authorities expressed their happiness for the exhibition, stressing the importance of the funder’s and the organizations’ efforts to transform vulnerable HHs into productive ones. Dr. Abdul Karim Shamsan, President of BCFHD, explained that BCFHD supports such projects because of their sustainable impact on poor HHs in terms of training, empowerment and improving livelihoods. Noting that BCFHD has a good record in this field and other fields. Dr. Faisal Al-Sabri, the project manager, indicated that the exhibition included variety of dairy products and that it comes after the conclusion of a three-month training program for 242 female breadwinners who expressed their happiness and satisfaction at the project and the exhibition.

pages.title: Inauguration of Drinking Water Distribution and Monitoring Water Quality Activities in Salh And Mudhaffar Districts – BCFHD
pages.summary: Inauguration of Drinking Water Distribution and Monitoring Water Quality Activities in Salh And Mudhaffar Districts Within the YHF-Funded WASH Project, BCFHD launched the activities of...
pages.content: Inauguration of Drinking Water Distribution and Monitoring Water Quality Activities in Salh And Mudhaffar Districts Within the YHF-Funded WASH Project, BCFHD launched the activities of distributing drinking water and monitoring water quality in IDP Sites and host communities in the districts of Salh and Mudhaffar. The activity aims to fill 91 points with clean drinking water benefiting 13,333 individuals. this activity is accompanied with water quality monitoring to guarantee clean and healthy water for the targeted HHs. It is worth noting that the volume of distributed drinking water is estimated at 100,000 liters per day, and the activity continues for 3 months.

pages.title: BCFHD distributes hygiene kits to the displaced in the districts of Mawza and Al-Shamaytayn – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD distributes hygiene kits to the displaced in the districts of Mawza and Al-Shamaytayn Within the activities of the Emergency Response Project for Displaced HHs Affected by Conflict which...
pages.content: BCFHD distributes hygiene kits to the displaced in the districts of Mawza and Al-Shamaytayn Within the activities of the Emergency Response Project for Displaced HHs Affected by Conflict which funded by (ECHO) and IRC, BCFHD distributed HKs to the IDPs in the districts of Mawza’ and Ash-Shamayatayn in Taiz Governorate, Sanad Ali, the project manager, said that this activity comes as an emergency response to the newly IDPs who displaced from the conflict areas to the districts of Mawza and Ash-Shamayatayn. He added that this activity is implemented in coordination with the Executive Unit for IDP Camps Management through which 220 displaced HHs were benefited. For his part, the beneficiaries of the project expressed their gratitude to the funding and implementing agencies, and also appealed to all organizations to intervene urgently, as they lack the most basic necessities of life.

pages.title: BCFHD organizes an extensive meeting on the governance of waste management and the hygiene promotion in the city of Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD organizes an extensive meeting on the governance of waste management and the hygiene promotion in the city of Taiz Under the patronage of the Governor of Taiz Governorate, and under the...
pages.content: BCFHD organizes an extensive meeting on the governance of waste management and the hygiene promotion in the city of Taiz Under the patronage of the Governor of Taiz Governorate, and under the slogan “Cleaning of my city is my responsibility,” BCFHD organized the expanded meeting of the executive offices, civil society organizations, and public and private institutions in Taiz on “The Governance of Waste Management” in the presence of the Deputy Governor. In the meeting, Dr. Abdul Karim Shamsan, President of BCFHD, pointed out the importance of the meeting to improve the cleanliness of the city, protect the environment, and came up with objective recommendations to dispose of waste through an integrative work among all. Deputy Governor, emphasized the importance of strengthening the role of the local authority and civil society in protecting the environment, calling for concerted efforts to get rid of waste and enhance the cleanliness of the city of Taiz. The meeting included many discussions, objective proposals by the participants, which focused on the need for a sustainable program for city cleaning, developing solutions for the spread of waste and the diseases and the spread of mosquitoes and flies, and intensifying awareness of citizens, in addition to many recommendations aimed at promoting and improving city cleaning and protecting the environment.

pages.title: BCFHD has concluded the course of “Managing the Psychological Stresses Affecting Workers in the Humanitarian Sector. – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD has concluded the course of “Managing the Psychological Stresses Affecting Workers in the Humanitarian Sector
pages.content: BCFHD has concluded the course of “Managing the Psychological Stresses Affecting Workers in the Humanitarian Sector. BCFHD has concluded the course of “Managing the Psychological Stresses Affecting Workers in the Humanitarian Sector”, which was organized over two consecutive days for BCFHD’s employees, as part of the Capacity Rehabilitation Program for the organization’s Workers. The course was presented by Magdi Al-Qabati, who focused on many aspects, most notably the definition of work stress and psychological stress, sources of stress, symptoms, effects, types of stress . Besides to methods and strategies for managing the stress by the organization as well as by employees, in addition to positive pressure. The course also dealt with Antares’ stress management methodology and its eight principles. The session came out with suggestions and recommendations that would contribute to enhancing the performance of workers under various pressures, and managing them in appropriate ways.

pages.title: BCFHD implements the kick-off workshop for the project of rehabilitation and empowerment for the affected people in Al-Mudhaffar District – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD implements the kick-off workshop for the project of rehabilitation and empowerment for the affected people in Al-Mudhaffar District Funded by YHF, and in the presence of a number of...
pages.content: BCFHD implements the kick-off workshop for the project of rehabilitation and empowerment for the affected people in Al-Mudhaffar District Funded by YHF, and in the presence of a number of representatives of local authority offices , BCFHD held the kick-off workshop for the project “Rehabilitation of the damaged houses of the vulnerable people (priority 2)” in Al Mudhaffar District – Taiz Governorate. Suleiman Ali, the project manager, explained that the workshop aims to introduce the project, its activities, and the implementation plan to the participants. He added; The project aims to help 44 vulnerable HHs in Al-Mudhaffar district by rehabilitating their damaged homes, in addition to empowering these HHs by providing vocational training and providing them with empowerment tools to start their own businesses and enhance their self-reliance to be able to meet their basic needs and be more stable.

pages.title: BCFHD Concludes the Training Course for 180 female students on Scientific Research in The Scientific Faculties of The Universities of Aden and Abyan Governorates – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD Concludes the Training Course for 180 female students on Scientific Research in The Scientific Faculties of The Universities of Aden and Abyan Governorates Within the project entitled...
pages.content: BCFHD Concludes the Training Course for 180 female students on Scientific Research in The Scientific Faculties of The Universities of Aden and Abyan Governorates Within the project entitled “Engage Her with Technology to Promote Peace” which is funded by the Cultural Exchange Program at the US Embassy in Yemen, BCFHD, in partnership with EDHR, concluded a 24-days training program in the field of scientific research for 180 female students from scientific faculties at Aden University and Abyan in the fields of scientific research . Riad Shamsan, the project manager, explained that the project targeted female students , where 120 female students were trained at the University of Aden, and 60 female students at the University of Abyan. He added: The project sought to enable the trainee students to access academic resources using technology, to be trained in the steps of scientific research, to improve speed- reading skills, and to self- learning electronically. The trainees praised the program as being one of the most wonderful and most valuable training programs as it fulfills the actual needs of scientific faculties students. At the end of the project, participation certificates were distributed to the trainee students of both universities.

pages.title: BCFHD concludes the open day for treating expectant mothers in Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD concludes the open day for treating expectant mothers in Taiz BCFHD concluded an open day activity for treating pregnant women in partnership with the 26th of September Center for Maternity...
pages.content: BCFHD concludes the open day for treating expectant mothers in Taiz BCFHD concluded an open day activity for treating pregnant women in partnership with the 26th of September Center for Maternity and Childhood and the Modern Pharma Company, and in coordination with the Public Health and Population Office and the local council of Al-Qahirah district. Ms. Abeer- the officer of protection sector for women and children in the Org., explained that the open day targeted pregnant mothers by providing free services such as examination, equipment and the provision of medicines, as 179 pregnant women benefited from the activity. She added: The activity was carried out in conjunction with the activities of International Women’s Day, and lasted for two days. She also commended all the parties participating in the open day for treating expectant mothers, offering them many thanks and gratitude for their interaction with the activities of the protection sector for women and children.

pages.title: The Director of the Education Office in Taiz inaugurates the distribution and installation of solar energy systems in the schools of Salh District – BCFHD
pages.summary: The Director of the Education Office in Taiz inaugurates the distribution and installation of solar energy systems in the schools of Salh District Within the activities of the project of “Improve...
pages.content: The Director of the Education Office in Taiz inaugurates the distribution and installation of solar energy systems in the schools of Salh District Within the activities of the project of “Improve access to safe education” which is funded by YHF and implemented by BCFHD, the Director General of the Education Office in Taiz Governorate, inaugurated the distribution and installation of solar energy systems to the targeted schools in Salh District, in the presence of some key-figures from local authorities and BCFHD. Abdul-Alam Aqlan – the project officer – explained that 13 solar systems have been installed for 13 schools in Salh district. Each solar system contains 3 panels of 340 watts, 2 batteries of 150 amps, a hyper VP-inverter, and other supplies. He also added that the safety installation of solar systems has been confirmed and that they will operate with a 220-watt electricity.

pages.title: BCFHD launches the Yemen Feeding Basket Project for the 2022 – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches the Yemen Feeding Basket Project for the 2022 Funded by KSrelief, BCFHD inaugurated, in Shabwa Governorate, the project of Feeding Basket Project for the 2022 in Baihan district in...
pages.content: BCFHD launches the Yemen Feeding Basket Project for the 2022 Funded by KSrelief, BCFHD inaugurated, in Shabwa Governorate, the project of Feeding Basket Project for the 2022 in Baihan district in the Republic of Yemen. Mohammed Khaled, representative of Bena Charity (BCFHD) in Shabwa Governorate, confirmed the start of distributing 1,584 baskets, benefiting 9,504 individuals in the districts of Bihan and Asilan, indicating that the distributions will continue until the quantity allocated to the two districts is exhausted. It is worth noting that this intervention comes within the Ramadan food baskets aid project and targets a number of Yemeni governorates for this year 2022. The project consists of 8,530 Ramadan food baskets, equivalent to 25,590 cartons, are distributed to 12,795 poor and conflict-affected families in 7 Yemeni governorates that will be targeted within the project plan.

Mohammed Khaled, representative of Bena Charity (BCFHD) in Shabwa Governorate, confirmed the start of distributing 1,584 baskets, benefiting 9,504 individuals in the districts of Bihan and Asilan, indicating that the distributions will continue until the quantity allocated to the two districts is exhausted.
It is worth noting that this intervention comes within the Ramadan food baskets aid project and targets a number of Yemeni governorates for this year 2022.

The project consists of 8,530 Ramadan food baskets, equivalent to 25,590 cartons, are distributed to 12,795 poor and conflict-affected families in 7 Yemeni governorates that will be targeted within the project plan.

pages.title: BCFHD and  Raedoon Foundation distribute supplies for people with mobility disabilities in Moqbna District – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD and Raedoon Foundation distribute supplies for people with mobility disabilities in Moqbna District Bena Charity for Human Development BCFHD
pages.content: BCFHD and Raedoon Foundation distribute supplies for people with mobility disabilities in Moqbna District Bena Charity for Human Development BCFHD. in partnership with the Raedoon Foundation for Sustainable Development and under the auspices of the district, Mr. Hamid Ghaleb implemented a project to distribute aids for people with mobility disabilities in the Moqbna district. 124 mobility aids distributed among shoulder crutches, walkers, quad crutches and bicycles were distributed. Director of the Executive Unit of the Directorate Jamal Farhan stressed the importance and role of assistive devices for people with mobility disabilities, especially in the recent events that the country is going through, extending his thanks to Bena Association, Raedoon Foundation, and all supporters for meeting such necessary needs, calling on all supporters and relevant authorities to pay attention to this segment of society.

pages.title: KSrelief continues to distribute food baskets in Mareb Governorate – BCFHD
pages.summary: KSrelief continues to distribute food baskets in Mareb Governorate Funded by KSrelief, BCFHD, launched the project of distributing food baskets which targeted (8530) individuals in Mareb...
pages.content: KSrelief continues to distribute food baskets in Mareb Governorate Funded by KSrelief, BCFHD, launched the project of distributing food baskets which targeted (8530) individuals in Mareb Governorate for the year 2022. Which consists of 8,530 Ramadan food baskets benefit 12,795 poor and conflict-affected families, and the number of beneficiaries is 76,770 individuals, in 7 Yemeni governorates. Dr. Khaled Al-Shajni, the Deputy Director of the Executive Unit for the Displaced praised. The role of the Ksrelief for its projects in various sectors of humanitarian work and for the support it provides to local and international organizations Bena Charity, the representative in Marib Governorate, Mr. Muhammad Hazaa, confirmed the start of distributing 2,925 baskets, which will benefit 17,550 individuals in the districts of Marib Al-Wadi, Marib Al-Madina and Harib. He indicated that the distributions will continue until the amount allocated to the three districts is exhausted. During the distribution, the beneficiaries expressed their thanks and gratitude to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, the king, the government, and the people for what it offers to Marib Governorate and its residents, and for standing by them always and alleviating their suffering.

pages.title: “BCFHD concludes the distribution of cash assistance to 450 affected families in Al-Shamaytayn District – BCFHD
pages.summary: “BCFHD concludes the distribution of cash assistance to 450 affected families in Al-Shamaytayn District Funded by, BCFHD has concluded the activity of distributing cash assistance to hundreds of...
pages.content: “BCFHD concludes the distribution of cash assistance to 450 affected families in Al-Shamaytayn District Funded by, BCFHD has concluded the activity of distributing cash assistance to hundreds of families in the isolation of (Dhbhan, Al Asabeh and Al Azaz) affiliated to its Al Shamayatain districts – Taiz Governorate, within the project “Providing emergency assistance in the field of agricultural livelihoods for families affected by the conflict and the Corona pandemic to improve food security and nutrition” The activity targeted 450 of the poorest families, by providing them with cash assistance, distributing laying hens, and poultry feed for each family, within a variety of activities targeting (11,090 families) in 22 isolates belonging to the Al-Shamaytayn District. It is worth noting that this activity was inaugurated last Saturday, April 16, 2022, in the presence of Eng. Mohamed Mahmoud – Director of Services Department in the Directorate, and Sultan Al-Asbahi – Director of Agriculture Department in the Directorate, with Dr. Faisal Al-Sabri, project coordinator in the Organisation.

Mr. Abdel Nasser director of the Social Affairs Office in Aden Governorate praised a. Arslan Al-Saqqaf praised the role of the King Salman Center for its projects in various sectors of humanitarian work, and for the support it provides to local and international organizations. Equivalent to . The supervisor of Aden Governorate indicated that the distributions will continue until the amount allocated to the Dar Saad and Al-Bariqa districts is exhausted. During the distribution, the people of Al-Bariqa district expressed their thanks and gratitude to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, the king, the government and the people for what it offers to the governorate of Aden and its residents, and for standing by them always and alleviating their suffering.

Mr. Abdullah Al-Tayyar, the representative of the King Salman Center for Relief and Humanitarian Works, and Mr. Suleiman Al-Samadi  the Project Manager a attended the inauguration.

stated that the inauguration 1485 baskets in Aden Governorate, which will benefit 8,910 individuals. Equivalent to . The supervisor of Aden Governorate indicated that the distributions will continue until the amount allocated to the Dar Saad and Al-Bariqa districts is exhausted.

During the distribution, the people of Al-Bariqa district expressed their thanks and gratitude to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, the king, the government and the people for what it offers to the governorate of Aden and its residents, and for standing by them always and alleviating their suffering.

pages.content: BCFHD distributed more than 600 IRC kits to newly displaced families in 4 districts in Taiz. funded by IRC, BCFHD distributed 631 health baskets targeting displaced families within the activities of the emergency response project for newly displaced families in Taiz Governorate As the activity benefited 425 newly displaced families in the districts of Mudhaffar, AL qahra and Salh, in addition to 206 families in the Al-Shamayatayn district.

pages.title: More than 160,000 people benefited from it.. “Bena” concludes Ramadan projects and activities in 7 governorates – BCFHD
pages.summary: More than 160,000 people benefited from it
pages.content: More than 160,000 people benefited from it.. “Bena” concludes Ramadan projects and activities in 7 governorates Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) completed projects and activities for the month of April 2022 in 6 Yemeni governorates, during which it targeted multiple groups and segments of Yemeni society during the blessed month of Ramadan 1443 AH. Mr. Tariq Al-Hammadi, Executive Director, explained that the association implemented 9 projects in the governorates of (Taiz – Aden – Shabwa – Marib – Mahra – Hodeidah). He added: The projects (food baskets, family and individual breakfast meals, cold drinking water, distribution of supplies for the disabled, distribution of hygiene materials in the Social Care and Correctional Home, distribution of cash assistance, education projects, water and environmental sanitation, and shelter) were implemented, where the number of beneficiaries reached more out of 23,000 families, noting that BCFHD conducted surveys for the urgent needs assessment process for about (11 districts) in Taiz governorate during this period. Al Hammadi stressed: “The association’s keenness to support and strengthen its humanitarian activities and voluntary programs at the level of all governorates, calling on institutions, the private sector, and supporters to intensify programs of a social and humanitarian nature. At the conclusion of his statement, Al Hammadi expressed his thanks to local, regional and international organizations and businessmen for their support of the association’s projects, as well as to all those who contributed to the success of these projects, praising the efforts of the association’s employees, partners and members of the field community committees.

pages.title: BCFHD and 13 donors launch a campaign of challenges and solutions for people with special needs – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD and 13 donors launch a campaign of challenges and solutions for people with special needs Founded by BCFHD, Basma Hayat inaugurated this morning a workshop (People with Special Needs
pages.content: BCFHD and 13 donors launch a campaign of challenges and solutions for people with special needs Founded by BCFHD, Basma Hayat inaugurated this morning a workshop (People with Special Needs. Challenges and Solutions) in the presence of Mr. Abdo Ali, Director of the Social Affairs and Labor Office in Taiz, and Mr. Tariq Al Hammadi, Directed of the chairty At the opening of the workshop, which was attended by 13 representatives of associations and centers specialized in caring for people with special needs, Mr. Abdo Ali stressed the importance of services that should be provided to people with special needs, noting that the responsibility rests with everyone from government agencies and relevant organizations. Director of the Bena Charity Mr. Tariq Al Hammadi, stressed the importance of concerted efforts and cooperation with various institutions within the framework of teamwork, explaining that this two-day workshop will discuss challenges and solutions for people with special needs through working groups and recommendations that will be presented by the various institutions participating in the workshop.

headings.text: BCFHD and 13 donors launch a campaign of challenges and solutions for people with special needs

paragraphs: Founded by BCFHD, Basma Hayat inaugurated this morning a workshop (People with Special Needs. Challenges and Solutions) in the presence of Mr. Abdo Ali, Director of the Social Affairs and Labor Office in Taiz, and Mr. Tariq Al Hammadi, Directed of the chairty

At the opening of the workshop, which was attended by 13 representatives of associations and centers specialized in caring for people with special needs, Mr. Abdo Ali stressed the importance of services that should be provided to people with special needs, noting that the responsibility rests with everyone from government agencies and relevant organizations.

Director of the Bena Charity Mr. Tariq Al Hammadi, stressed the importance of concerted efforts and cooperation with various institutions within the framework of teamwork, explaining that this two-day workshop will discuss challenges and solutions for people with special needs through working groups and recommendations that will be presented by the various institutions participating in the workshop.

pages.title: “BCFHD” launches a training workshop on project writing and   fundraising of 20 organizations in Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: “BCFHD” launches a training workshop on project writing and fundraising of 20 organizations in Taiz BCFHD launched this morning a training workshop for nascent NGOs on On proposal writing and...
pages.content: “BCFHD” launches a training workshop on project writing and fundraising of 20 organizations in Taiz BCFHD launched this morning a training workshop for nascent NGOs on On proposal writing and fundraising… the participation of 20 NGOs in Taiz governorate. The training workshop, implementatd by Sulaiman Al Samadi – project officer at the association, aims to strengthen the theoretical, cognitive and practical capacities of participants on the preparation of projects to meet the needs in an organized manner and in line with donor standards. The workshop addresses the proposals, objectives, logical framework, activities, Action Plan and Target groups, in addition to measuring the capabilities of the organization and implementing partners in the sustainability of the project. Participates in the workshop, which includes many discussions and interventions participants stressed the importance of this workshop in building capacity and enhancing skills in the field of project preparation, expressing their thanks to BCFHD Association and its effective role in various aspects, especially in the field of training and rehabilitation and 20 participants representing 20 NNGOs working in ST.

pages.summary: “BCFHD” qualifies and receives a water project in the Directorate of Maqbana in Taiz governorate Director General of Maqbana Directorate,Mr Humaid Al-Khalidi, and Mr
pages.content: “BCFHD” qualifies and receives a water project in the Directorate of Maqbana in Taiz governorate Director General of Maqbana Directorate,Mr. Humaid Al-Khalidi, and Mr. Tariq Al-Hammadi, executive director of ( BCFHD), opened this morning the water project of Dar Al-qamoush and Al-rawina village in the isolation of barasha of the Directorate, which was implemented by the association within the activities of the Emergency Response project for newly displaced families in Taiz governorate, funded by the European Union and the International Rescue committeer etc . pages.title: The United Nations delegation visits the sites of the displaced, which are supervised by the “BCFHD ” in the Salh district of Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: The United Nations delegation visits the sites of the displaced, which are supervised by the “BCFHD ” in the Salh district of Taiz Within the field visits in Taiz carried out by the delegation of...
pages.content: The United Nations delegation visits the sites of the displaced, which are supervised by the “BCFHD ” in the Salh district of Taiz Within the field visits in Taiz carried out by the delegation of United Nations organizations headed by the Deputy Humanitarian Coordinator of the United Nations in Yemen, Mr. Diego Zorrilla, the United Nations delegation visited the sites of displaced persons managed and implemented by the (BCFHD), with the participation of representatives of “OCHA, the World Food Program and UNICEF” Development Programs, FAO and International Migration” and representatives of the local authority in Taiz. On the visit, which was accompanied by Dr. Abdul Karim Shamsan, President of the association, Dr. Marwan Moqbel and the rest of the association’s team in charge of the project of sheltering and managing IDP sites in Salh district, to inform them about the nature of the projects implemented for IDPs in the district, where the international team interviewed some of the beneficiaries and those responsible for managing the sites. The impact of the project activities implemented by the association in the sites, and their impression of the assistance provided to them. For its part, the delegation praised the efforts made by the BCFHD)، Association in managing the sites of the displaced in the Sala district, and expressed their satisfaction with the implementation of the projects through the interviews conducted with the beneficiaries and the relevant authorities, which praised the role of the Bena Association in achieving tangible results by providing humanitarian assistance to vulnerable groups of displaced persons. And the host community in the district. In the same context, the Deputy Coordinator for Humanitarian Affairs Diego Zorrilla considered that the visit of the delegation representing all United Nations organizations for the first time to the city of Taiz confirms their interest in this governorate, and their efforts to alleviate the suffering of it through the efforts it makes on the humanitarian side

paragraphs: Within the field visits in Taiz carried out by the delegation of United Nations organizations headed by the Deputy Humanitarian Coordinator of the United Nations in Yemen, Mr. Diego Zorrilla, the United Nations delegation visited the sites of displaced persons managed and implemented by the (BCFHD), with the participation of representatives of “OCHA, the World Food Program and UNICEF” Development Programs, FAO and International Migration” and representatives of the local authority in Taiz.

On the visit, which was accompanied by Dr. Abdul Karim Shamsan, President of the association, Dr. Marwan Moqbel and the rest of the association’s team in charge of the project of sheltering and managing IDP sites in Salh district, to inform them about the nature of the projects implemented for IDPs in the district, where the international team interviewed some of the beneficiaries and those responsible for managing the sites. The impact of the project activities implemented by the association in the sites, and their impression of the assistance provided to them.

For its part, the delegation praised the efforts made by the BCFHD)، Association in managing the sites of the displaced in the Sala district, and expressed their satisfaction with the implementation of the projects through the interviews conducted with the beneficiaries and the relevant authorities, which praised the role of the Bena Association in achieving tangible results by providing humanitarian assistance to vulnerable groups of displaced persons. And the host community in the district.

In the same context, the Deputy Coordinator for Humanitarian Affairs Diego Zorrilla considered that the visit of the delegation representing all United Nations organizations for the first time to the city of Taiz confirms their interest in this governorate, and their efforts to alleviate the suffering of it through the efforts it makes on the humanitarian side

pages.title: The start of the first phase of rehabilitation of damaged houses in Al-Mudhaffar District, Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: The start of the first phase of rehabilitation of damaged houses in Al-Mudhaffar District, Taiz The work of the first phase of the rehabilitation of damaged homes is continuing within the project...
pages.content: The start of the first phase of rehabilitation of damaged houses in Al-Mudhaffar District, Taiz The work of the first phase of the rehabilitation of damaged homes is continuing within the project “Rehabilitation of the Damaged Houses of the Vulnerable (Priority 2) – and linking this to livelihood support to empower the targeted families in Al Mudhaffar District – Taiz Governorate” implemented by Bena Charity for Human Development BCFHD and funded by the Humanitarian Fund for Yemen YHF. The rehabilitation targets 44 houses in the Mudhaffar district (Bir al-Wafi neighborhood and Shaab al-Haddad neighborhood), among the houses damaged by the war. The rehabilitation activity comes immediately after the delivery of the first batch of cash assistance to 44 of the most needy and vulnerable families to be used in the rehabilitation of their homes. The first phase includes pouring damaged rooms in addition to internal and external plastering works, while the next stages include the installation of doors, windows and water tanks. Sanitary and electrical installations, and supplying homes with a solar array that will be used to light homes. The project is an extension of the association’s interventions in the shelter sector, where this is the first phase and will be followed by two phases in the coming months

headings.text: The start of the first phase of rehabilitation of damaged houses in Al-Mudhaffar District, Taiz

paragraphs: The work of the first phase of the rehabilitation of damaged homes is continuing within the project “Rehabilitation of the Damaged Houses of the Vulnerable (Priority 2) – and linking this to livelihood support to empower the targeted families in Al Mudhaffar District – Taiz Governorate” implemented by Bena Charity for Human Development BCFHD and funded by the Humanitarian Fund for Yemen YHF.
The rehabilitation targets 44 houses in the Mudhaffar district (Bir al-Wafi neighborhood and Shaab al-Haddad neighborhood), among the houses damaged by the war.

The rehabilitation activity comes immediately after the delivery of the first batch of cash assistance to 44 of the most needy and vulnerable families to be used in the rehabilitation of their homes. The first phase includes pouring damaged rooms in addition to internal and external plastering works, while the next stages include the installation of doors, windows and water tanks. Sanitary and electrical installations, and supplying homes with a solar array that will be used to light homes.
The project is an extension of the association’s interventions in the shelter sector, where this is the first phase and will be followed by two phases in the coming months

pages.title: (BCFHD) Launching a training course in the field of peace and governance for people with special needs at Taiz University – BCFHD
pages.summary: (BCFHD) Launching a training course in the field of peace and governance for people with special needs at Taiz University Under the patronage of Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD), the...
pages.content: (BCFHD) Launching a training course in the field of peace and governance for people with special needs at Taiz University Under the patronage of Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD), the Youth Forum for People with Special Needs launched this morning a training course entitled “Peacemaking and inclusive governance in sign language” at Taiz University, as part of the “Peace Pioneers Project” implemented by Basmat Hayat Foundation for People with Special Needs. The course, which is attended by 25 students of the deaf and dumb category at Taiz University, aims to educate the disabled about the importance of building peace and peaceful coexistence, knowing its levels and acquiring skills The course also deals with knowledge of the elements and stages of conflict and the need to get rid of it, in addition to providing people with disabilities with concepts of governance and its impact on the transparency of dealings in centers for people with disabilities

The course, which is attended by 25 students of the deaf and dumb category at Taiz University, aims to educate the disabled about the importance of building peace and peaceful coexistence, knowing its levels and acquiring skills The course also deals with knowledge of the elements and stages of conflict and the need to get rid of it, in addition to providing people with disabilities with concepts of governance and its impact on the transparency of dealings in centers for people with disabilities

headings.text: (BCFHD) Launching a training course in the field of peace and governance for people with special needs at Taiz University

paragraphs: Under the patronage of Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD), the Youth Forum for People with Special Needs launched this morning a training course entitled “Peacemaking and inclusive governance in sign language” at Taiz University, as part of the “Peace Pioneers Project” implemented by Basmat Hayat Foundation for People with Special Needs.

The course, which is attended by 25 students of the deaf and dumb category at Taiz University, aims to educate the disabled about the importance of building peace and peaceful coexistence, knowing its levels and acquiring skills The course also deals with knowledge of the elements and stages of conflict and the need to get rid of it, in addition to providing people with disabilities with concepts of governance and its impact on the transparency of dealings in centers for people with disabilities

pages.title: (BCFHD)distributes 4,500 laying hens to the most vulnerable families in Al-Shamaitain District, Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: (BCFHD)distributes 4,500 laying hens to the most vulnerable families in Al-Shamaitain District, Taiz BCFHD Charitable Society for Human Development (BCFHD) has concluded distributing thousands of...
pages.content: (BCFHD)distributes 4,500 laying hens to the most vulnerable families in Al-Shamaitain District, Taiz BCFHD Charitable Society for Human Development (BCFHD) has concluded distributing thousands of laying hens to hundreds of the most vulnerable families in the Al-Shamaytayn district of the Taiz governorate, as part of the emergency aid project for the most vulnerable families in Yemen No. (002) implemented by the association with funding from (OCHA) through the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), in the presence of Brother Sultan Al-Asbahi, Director of the Agriculture Office in the Directorate. Dr. Faisal Al-Sabri, the project manager, explained that (4,500) four thousand and five hundred laying hens were distributed targeting (450) families in the isolation of Dhahban, Al-Azaz and Al-Asabeh affiliated to the Al-Shamaitain District, at a rate of (10) chickens per family, in addition to providing (100) kg of chicken. of poultry feed for each family. He added: This activity aims to support the resilience of vulnerable families and help them improve family nutrition and improve the level of income. It is worth noting that this activity comes among other activities in agricultural and animal inputs targeting (11,090) families in 22 isolates of the Al-Shamayatain district, and it includes the provision of cash assistance, in addition to the activity of training women of childbearing age in the nutritional field for (10,640) women. This activity has met with great satisfaction among the beneficiaries in light of the difficult living and economic conditions of the citizens

pages.content: (BCFHD) distributes 800 shelter bags through the cash assistance system for the displaced in Salalah district This morning, Thursday, May 26, 2022, BCFHD began implementing the basic shelter bag distribution activity within the project of managing and coordinating the sites of the displaced, improving the living conditions and access to aid for vulnerable families of the displaced in Sala district, and providing emergency aid to the vulnerable groups of the displaced and host communities in the Makbna district – Taiz governorate, Which is financed by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund YHF. The activity targets 800 displaced families and host families in Salh district through the cash assistance system

pages.title: (BCFHD) and FAO Association organize radio awareness seminars on agricultural activities – BCFHD
pages.summary: (BCFHD) and FAO Association organize radio awareness seminars on agricultural activities The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), with the support of the King Salman Center for Relief and...
pages.content: (BCFHD) and FAO Association organize radio awareness seminars on agricultural activities The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), with the support of the King Salman Center for Relief and Humanitarian Works, and in coordination with the Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD), launched an awareness radio program on agricultural activities on Taiz State Radio. This program comes within the activities of the emergency aid project for the population affected by the conflict and the Corona pandemic to improve food security and nutrition in Yemen, which is implemented by the association in the Al-Shamaytayn District. The program contains many episodes that are broadcast daily, starting today. They deal with various agricultural topics aimed at raising awareness and guiding farmers through specialists in this field. For those interested: The program is broadcast daily It’s ten in the morning Taiz Radio

pages.title: BCFHD conclusion of the training workshop on family nutrition in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD conclusion of the training workshop on family nutrition in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Today, BCFHD concluded a training workshop on family nutrition in Al-Shamaitin District, as part of...
pages.content: BCFHD conclusion of the training workshop on family nutrition in Al-Shamayatayn District, Taiz Today, BCFHD concluded a training workshop on family nutrition in Al-Shamaitin District, as part of the emergency assistance project in the field of agricultural livelihoods for families affected by the conflict and the Corona pandemic to improve food security and nutrition, which is implemented by the association, funded by the King Salman Center for Relief and Humanitarian Action KSrelief, in partnership with the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO). The workshop targeted 20 trainees from nutrition specialists, during four days of training, which dealt with a number of themes related to family nutrition. According to the project plan, 20 nutritionists who were included in the training will carry out an awareness-raising activity during the coming period (10,640) girls from each family targeted by the project, in 24 isolates of the Al-Shamayatain district, who are of childbearing age and who actively participate in preparing food for these families. The awareness raising targets (1620) families benefiting from the agricultural input, in addition to (9020) families benefiting from the animal entrance

pages.summary: The first meeting with the local authority and community leaders in the Al-Mawasit District BCFHD held the first meeting with the local authority and community leaders in Al-Mawasit district...
pages.content: The first meeting with the local authority and community leaders in the Al-Mawasit District BCFHD held the first meeting with the local authority and community leaders in Al-Mawasit district within the activities of the “Emergency Livelihood Assistance Project to Address the Negative Impact of High Prices in Yemen”, funded from the joint budget through the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs in partnership with the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) ). At the beginning of the meeting, which was held at the headquarters of the local council in the district center (Al Ain), the Director General of Al-Mawasit District, the head of the local council, Mr. Amin Sharaf Al-Fadhli, welcomed the visiting team from Bena Association headed by Dr. Faisal Abdulghani, the project manager, who in turn thanked the association for the representatives of the local authority in Al-Mawasit district. During the meeting, many technical aspects of the project to be implemented in the district were discussed, in addition to defining the scope of targeting in the isolated and affiliated villages of Al-Muwasit, and facilitating the process of community mobilization and registration of beneficiaries. For his part, Al-Fadhli thanked Bena Association and the FAO for this intervention, and promised to provide all facilities to implement the project. The meeting was attended by Mr. Abdullah Abdul Rahman Muglas, Secretary-General of the Local Council, and Director of the Agriculture Office in the Al-Mawasit District. It is worth noting that the project aims to provide agricultural seeds and emergency cash assistance to 4,000 families in the Al-Mawasit district

headings.text: The first meeting with the local authority and community leaders in the Al-Mawasit District

paragraphs: BCFHD held the first meeting with the local authority and community leaders in Al-Mawasit district within the activities of the “Emergency Livelihood Assistance Project to Address the Negative Impact of High Prices in Yemen”, funded from the joint budget through the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs in partnership with the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) ).

At the beginning of the meeting, which was held at the headquarters of the local council in the district center (Al Ain), the Director General of Al-Mawasit District, the head of the local council, Mr. Amin Sharaf Al-Fadhli, welcomed the visiting team from Bena Association headed by Dr. Faisal Abdulghani, the project manager, who in turn thanked the association for the representatives of the local authority in Al-Mawasit district.

During the meeting, many technical aspects of the project to be implemented in the district were discussed, in addition to defining the scope of targeting in the isolated and affiliated villages of Al-Muwasit, and facilitating the process of community mobilization and registration of beneficiaries.
For his part, Al-Fadhli thanked Bena Association and the FAO for this intervention, and promised to provide all facilities to implement the project.
The meeting was attended by Mr. Abdullah Abdul Rahman Muglas, Secretary-General of the Local Council, and Director of the Agriculture Office in the Al-Mawasit District.

pages.title: 26 years ago.. a journey full of giving, bena and sustainable development The General Assembly of ” BCFHD Charity” holds its seventh session, and amendments are made to its administrative and supervisory bodies – BCFHD
pages.summary: 26 years ago
pages.content: 26 years ago.. a journey full of giving, bena and sustainable development The General Assembly of ” BCFHD Charity” holds its seventh session, and amendments are made to its administrative and supervisory bodies The General Assembly, the highest authority in Bena Charity for Human Development BCFHD, concluded this evening the work of its seventh “extraordinary” session in the Al-Rowad University hall, in the presence of more than two-thirds of the members of the general assembly and the participation of Mr. Abdo Ali, Director of the Office of Social Affairs and Labor in Taiz Governorate. The session opened its work with verses from the Holy Quran, followed by a speech by the President of the Society, Dr. Abdul Karim Shamsan, in which he welcomed the attendees, each in his own name and capacity, praising the role of the General Assembly, the Administrative Board and the Oversight Committee in serving the Society’s goals and achieving its strategy in building the present and charting the future. Shamsan also presented his general report, outlining the most important achievements of the association during the past period, and touched on the most important projects and the expansion of their implementation in a number of Yemeni governorates, explaining partnerships with many international donor organizations working in the humanitarian field. The financial and administrative report and the chartered accountant’s report were also reviewed, in addition to the report of the Oversight Committee, which was followed by an extensive discussion that included clarifications and objections that do not go outside the purposeful scope of the meeting and added more vitality and transparency to the meeting, followed by voting on the financial and administrative report and their approval. After that, the Director of the Social Affairs and Labor Office announced the opening of candidacy for the election of a new administrative body and a supervisory committee after the previous committee and committee submitted their resignations. In a positive atmosphere, the door for candidacy was opened for the administrative board and the supervisory committee, and then voting was done by secret ballot using the fund mechanism, which resulted in the renewal of confidence for some personalities and changes as follows: Dr. Abdul Karim Shamsan – President of the Association Sheikh Najeeb Abdel Raouf – Vice President Mr. Tawfiq Abdel-Khabir – Secretary General Mr. Shaif Hammoud – Financial Officer The remaining members of the administrative board were elected, headed by Mr. Muhammad Ali Ismail, in addition to: – Professor Abdul Majeed Muhammad Ghalib – Professor Amin Ahmed Mikred Professor Salim Abdel Rahman Professor Khaled Abdo Omar – Ms. Faida Sharaf Ms. Tahani Mohamed Said The oversight committee was also announced, and they are as follows: Mr. Arif Abdo Seif Professor Mansour Mohamed Ahmed Professor Sultan Shaif Professor Abdelkader Ahmed Mohamed Professor Soldier Muhammad Abdullah The meeting concluded with the first session of the administrative body, where the tasks and competencies were defined, and the date of the next meeting was set. It is a building.. a name with rain falling on the parched earth.. it draws landmarks, sows the seeds of light.. and lays the foundations of renaissance.. it opens the windows of knowledge and makes of its sparkling suits medals of pride. For nearly (26) years, construction has been moving steadily towards achieving its goals for human development and the renaissance of the nation, and a panorama of success paths, with a tight consensus of great impac
