headings.text: 26 years ago.. a journey full of giving, bena and sustainable development The General Assembly of ” BCFHD Charity” holds its seventh session, and amendments are made to its administrative and supervisory bodies

paragraphs: The General Assembly, the highest authority in Bena Charity for Human Development BCFHD, concluded this evening the work of its seventh “extraordinary” session in the Al-Rowad University hall, in the presence of more than two-thirds of the members of the general assembly and the participation of Mr. Abdo Ali, Director of the Office of Social Affairs and Labor in Taiz Governorate.

The session opened its work with verses from the Holy Quran, followed by a speech by the President of the Society, Dr. Abdul Karim Shamsan, in which he welcomed the attendees, each in his own name and capacity, praising the role of the General Assembly, the Administrative Board and the Oversight Committee in serving the Society’s goals and achieving its strategy in building the present and charting the future.

Shamsan also presented his general report, outlining the most important achievements of the association during the past period, and touched on the most important projects and the expansion of their implementation in a number of Yemeni governorates, explaining partnerships with many international donor organizations working in the humanitarian field.

The financial and administrative report and the chartered accountant’s report were also reviewed, in addition to the report of the Oversight Committee, which was followed by an extensive discussion that included clarifications and objections that do not go outside the purposeful scope of the meeting and added more vitality and transparency to the meeting, followed by voting on the financial and administrative report and their approval.

After that, the Director of the Social Affairs and Labor Office announced the opening of candidacy for the election of a new administrative body and a supervisory committee after the previous committee and committee submitted their resignations.

pages.title: ” BCFHD concludes distributing cash assistance to rehabilitate damaged houses in Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: ” BCFHD concludes distributing cash assistance to rehabilitate damaged houses in Taiz BCFHD has concluded the distribution of the third and final batch of cash assistance within the project...
pages.content: ” BCFHD concludes distributing cash assistance to rehabilitate damaged houses in Taiz BCFHD has concluded the distribution of the third and final batch of cash assistance within the project “Rehabilitation of the Damaged Houses of the Vulnerable (Priority 2) – linking this to livelihood support to empower the targeted families in Al Mudhaffar District – Taiz Governorate” funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund YHF. Suleiman Al-Samadi, the project manager, explained that the project comes as an extension of the BCFHD interventions in the shelter sector and aimed to rehabilitate 44 houses in the Al-Mudhaffar district (Bir Al-Wafi neighborhood and Shaab Al-Haddad neighborhood), from the houses that were damaged by the war

pages.title: Baseline Survey and Verification Training Workshop for Agricultural Families in Al-Mawasit District, Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: Baseline Survey and Verification Training Workshop for Agricultural Families in Al-Mawasit District, Taiz This morning, BCFHD carried out a survey training workshop in the city of Al-Turbah...
pages.content: Baseline Survey and Verification Training Workshop for Agricultural Families in Al-Mawasit District, Taiz This morning, BCFHD carried out a survey training workshop in the city of Al-Turbah within the activities of the project “Emergency Assistance for Agricultural Livelihoods to Address the Effects of Rising Prices in Yemen – Al-Mawasit District – Taiz Governorate, funded by the Food Organization (FAO). The goal of the work shop is to train baseline team to conduct baseline survey and verification for 158 out of (4000) in AL – mawast . The workshop was carried out by Mr. Osama Al-Kebsi from the Food and Agricultural Organization HHS that of the united natin (FAO) for surveyors from the Bena Association It is worth noting that this exclusive project. Aims at distributing vegetables seeds and cash + to agricultural HHS that own land and have water source.

The goal of the work shop is to train baseline team to conduct  baseline survey and  verification for 158 out of  (4000)   in AL – mawast .
The workshop was carried out by Mr. Osama Al-Kebsi from the Food and Agricultural Organization HHS that of the united natin    (FAO) for surveyors from the Bena Association
It is worth noting that this exclusive project. Aims at distributing vegetables seeds and cash +  to agricultural HHS that own land and have water source.

pages.title: BCFHD concludes the distribution of cash assistance and agricultural seeds to 4,000 HHs in Al-Mawasit District, Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD concludes the distribution of cash assistance and agricultural seeds to 4,000 HHs in Al-Mawasit District, Taiz BCFHD concluded the activities of distributing unconditional cash assistance...
pages.content: BCFHD concludes the distribution of cash assistance and agricultural seeds to 4,000 HHs in Al-Mawasit District, Taiz BCFHD concluded the activities of distributing unconditional cash assistance and distributing vegetable seeds within the project “Emergency Livelihood Assistance to Address the Negative Impact of Rising Food Prices in Yeme – Al-Mawasit District – Taiz , Funded by the joint fund of the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs in partnership with the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) Dr. Faisal Al Sabri – project coordinator declared that 4000 HH s were benefeted from the unconditional cash assistance seven subdistrict (Al-Akhmur – Al-Ayfua – Al-Aloum – Bani Hammad – Bani Abbas – Bani Yusuf – Quds) of the Al-Mawasit Directorate. He added: The project also distributed a vegetable seeds kits to each of the agricultural HHs targeted by the project He pointed out that during the coming period, the extension staff of the Ministry of Agriculture and Irrigation and Welfare affairs will provide training awareness to the targeted beneficiaries about good agricultural practices.

He added: The project also distributed a vegetable seeds kits to each of the agricultural HHs targeted by the project He pointed out that during the coming period, the extension staff of the Ministry of Agriculture and Irrigation and Welfare affairs will provide training awareness to the targeted beneficiaries about good agricultural practices.

headings.text: BCFHD concludes the distribution of cash assistance and agricultural seeds to 4,000 HHs in Al-Mawasit District, Taiz

paragraphs: BCFHD concluded the activities of distributing unconditional cash assistance and distributing vegetable seeds within the project “Emergency Livelihood Assistance to Address the Negative Impact of Rising Food Prices in Yeme – Al-Mawasit District – Taiz , Funded by the joint fund of the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs in  partnership with the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

Dr. Faisal Al Sabri – project coordinator declared that 4000 HH s were benefeted from the unconditional cash assistance seven subdistrict  (Al-Akhmur – Al-Ayfua – Al-Aloum – Bani Hammad – Bani Abbas – Bani Yusuf – Quds) of the Al-Mawasit Directorate.
He added: The project also distributed a vegetable seeds kits  to each of the agricultural HHs targeted by the project

He pointed out that during the coming period, the extension staff of the Ministry of Agriculture and Irrigation and Welfare affairs will provide  training awareness to the targeted beneficiaries about good agricultural practices.

pages.title: The Women and Child Protection Sector in BCFHD organizes an awareness event on the occasion of the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women – BCFHD
pages.summary: The Women and Child Protection Sector in BCFHD organizes an awareness event on the occasion of the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women The protection sector for women...
pages.content: The Women and Child Protection Sector in BCFHD organizes an awareness event on the occasion of the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women The protection sector for women and children at BCFHD organized an awareness event in the occasion of the “International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women”, which is celebrated on November 25 of each year, and lasts for 16 days, starting from November 25 to December 10, the International Day human rights. The awareness event was launched under the slogan of the campaign for the current year 2022 (What do you do to protect women and fulfill their needs?), as it included educational messages that dealt with the following topics: Protect her rights Her dignity is our dignity Protection is everyone’s right – From protecting women, educating and empowering them Women are the sisters of men Honor her in honor of your family – She is your mother.. She is your sister.. She is your wife, so be kind to her. It is worth noting that this occasion is celebrated on November 25 of each year (symbolized in orange) to combat violence against women and call for its elimination, which was approved by the United Nations General Assembly in 1999 as a response to the calls made by some women’s organizations to combat violence against women. This celebration is a call from all governmental and non-governmental organizations and institutions to organize programs that raise awareness of the violence that is practiced against women in most societies, the harsh treatment that is directed at them, and the denunciation of the heinous crimes that are practiced against women in general

Her dignity is our dignity
Protection is everyone’s right
– From protecting women, educating and empowering them

pages.title: BCFHD implements a workshop for the Child Protection Needs Assessment Team in 13 districts of Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD implements a workshop for the Child Protection Needs Assessment Team in 13 districts of Taiz BCFHD implemented this morning a training workshop for the “Child Protection Needs Assessment...
pages.content: BCFHD implements a workshop for the Child Protection Needs Assessment Team in 13 districts of Taiz BCFHD implemented this morning a training workshop for the “Child Protection Needs Assessment Team and Update Service Providers Maps”, within the project “Conducting a rapid needs assessment and updating service providers maps to identify child protection needs and gaps in Taiz Governorate”, funded by the Ministry of Social Affairs. The Norwegian Foreign Ministry (NMFA) and Save the Children. Dr. Abdul Karim Shamsan, the head of the Charity, explained that the project aims to access an updated database of the needs and risks of children in the IDP sites. He added: The needs assessment project will include 13 districts in Taiz Governorate (Cairo, Al-Muzaffar, Salh, Jabal Habashi, Al-Misrakh, Al-Ma’afer, Al-Shamayatain, Maqbanah, Saber Al-Mawadim, Al-Mokha, Mawza’, Al-Waz’iya and Dhu Bab), stressing the importance and necessity of this assessment in providing Recent data and information that lead to developing plans to respond to the child protection needs of the relevant organizations The training centered on the survey form and input via “Cobo”, methods of collecting information, and analyzing data, in the hall of Al-Jand University, with the participation of 31 trainee.

pages.title: (BCFHD)concludes the first coordination meetings with the community committees in the districts of Salah and Al Mudhaffar in Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: (BCFHD)concludes the first coordination meetings with the community committees in the districts of Salah and Al Mudhaffar in Taiz BCFHD concluded the first coordination meetings with community...
pages.content: (BCFHD)concludes the first coordination meetings with the community committees in the districts of Salah and Al Mudhaffar in Taiz BCFHD concluded the first coordination meetings with community committees in the districts of Salah and Al Mudhaffar in Taiz, as part of the activities of the project “Improving the living conditions of the most vulnerable families of the displaced, the host community and returnees by providing sustainable shelter solutions”, which is implemented by the association in the districts of Salah and Al Mudhaffar (Taiz Governorate), and the two districts of Ma’rib Medina and Marib Al Wadi (Marib Governorate), funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF). The coordination meetings, which were attended by 27 community members, aimed at defining the goals and activities of the project, training community committees on the registration form for the initial lists of beneficiaries, as well as clarifying the criteria for selecting beneficiaries and the complaints mechanisms for the project, in addition to forming focus discussions with the committee, taking their opinions and answering their questions. The meetings were attended by the project manager, monitoring and evaluation assistant, field assistant, as well as community workers.

pages.title: BCFHD issues its annual report 2022 – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD issues its annual report 2022 BCFHD, issued its annual report for the year 2022, in which it reviewed the most prominent projects of the sectors implemented by the association during the...
pages.content: BCFHD issues its annual report 2022 BCFHD, issued its annual report for the year 2022, in which it reviewed the most prominent projects of the sectors implemented by the association during the whole year. Dr. Abdul Karim Shamsan, the head of the association, explained that more than 34 major projects and activities have been implemented in 7 governorates inside Yemen, in partnership with 12 international and local organizations. He added: More than 600,000 individuals benefited from the 2022 projects, in 7 main sectors, as the report included detailed data in numbers in the sectors of food security and livelihoods, water and environmental sanitation, protection, education, shelter and health. Dr. Abdul Karim Shamsan expressed his great thanks and gratitude to all the supporting agencies and organizations that funded the projects, in addition to government offices and related agencies. He added: I also extend my thanks and appreciation to the administrative and oversight bodies and all workers in the association and volunteers for their sincere efforts and dedication in implementing humanitarian development services. https://bcfhd.org/report/annualreport2022.pdf

headings.text: BCFHD issues its annual report 2022

paragraphs: BCFHD, issued its annual report for the year 2022, in which it reviewed the most prominent projects of the sectors implemented by the association during the whole year.

Dr. Abdul Karim Shamsan, the head of the association, explained that more than 34 major projects and activities have been implemented in 7 governorates inside Yemen, in partnership with 12 international and local organizations.

He added: More than 600,000 individuals benefited from the 2022 projects, in 7 main sectors, as the report included detailed data in numbers in the sectors of food security and livelihoods, water and environmental sanitation, protection, education, shelter and health.
Dr. Abdul Karim Shamsan expressed his great thanks and gratitude to all the supporting agencies and organizations that funded the projects, in addition to government offices and related agencies.

He added: I also extend my thanks and appreciation to the administrative and oversight bodies and all workers in the association and volunteers for their sincere efforts and dedication in implementing humanitarian development services.

pages.title: The representative of the Education Cluster in Taiz visits the training halls of volunteer teachers in Salh District – BCFHD
pages.summary: The representative of the Education Cluster in Taiz visits the training halls of volunteer teachers in Salh District Mr
pages.content: The representative of the Education Cluster in Taiz visits the training halls of volunteer teachers in Salh District Mr. Shadi Al-Mashreqi – representative of the Education Cluster in Taiz and the West Coast visited this morning the training halls of the second batch of volunteer teachers, who are being trained by BCFHD as part of the activities of the Project “Improving the Educational Environment for vulnerable school – aged children in the affected schools shall district taiz governorate under pnority(2) ” Conflict-Affected Schools under the Second Priority”, Mr. Mashreqi was received by Mr . Zaid Al-Amiri, project manager, and Abdul-Alam Aklan, education officer in the project. It is worth noting that the training activity started two days ago, targeting 22 teachers22 male 178 female volunteers in 21 schools in the Salh district in the field of child protection and raising awareness of their rights psychological support and referral mechanism

pages.title: It will target 200 male and female teachers.. “BCFHD” launches the disbursement of cash incentives to volunteer teachers in the Salh district of Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: It will target 200 male and female teachers
pages.content: It will target 200 male and female teachers.. “BCFHD” launches the disbursement of cash incentives to volunteer teachers in the Salh district of Taiz BCFHD launched the provision of cash incentives to 200 male and female volunteer teachers in the Salh district of Taiz governorate, as part of the activities of the Improving the Educational Environment for vulnerable school – aged children in the affected schools shall district Taiz governorate under pnority(2) “” This is the first batch of 6 monthly batches for the volunteers who were trained during the past daysthe targeted teachers are 22male and 178 female from 21 targeted schools . It is worth noting that the project’s activities include distributing cash incentives to volunteer teachers and training them, in addition to distributing double desks, blackboards, sanitary kit , and solar power systems to a number of schools in Salh directorate, funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund – YHF.

pages.title: BCFHD receives the delegation of the United Nations organizations and the German embassy – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD receives the delegation of the United Nations organizations and the German embassy As part of the field visits in Taiz, which are carried out by the delegation of the United Nations...
pages.content: BCFHD receives the delegation of the United Nations organizations and the German embassy As part of the field visits in Taiz, which are carried out by the delegation of the United Nations organizations and the German embassy, ​​ Riyadh Shamsan, Director of Programs at the Bena Charity for Human Development BCFHD, as area based coordinator of the IDPs sites in Al-Jahmaliya Al-Wusta area in the Directorate of Salah, received today a delegation of UNICEF and the United Nations Development Program (UNDP) headed by Atsuru Takashi and Sunitaka Suchaya and the head of cooperation in the German Embassy, ​​Marcela Masiarik. During the visit, which aimed to get acquainted with the humanitarian needs closely, the urgent needs in the field of water and sanitation were presented, as well as the suffering of the IDPs and their basic needs. During their tour in the IDPs sites, the delegation met the children of Al-Najah School in Al-Jahmaliya, where they listened to some examples of the students. The delegation was accompanied by Eng. Ali Al-Qubati, coordinator of the WASH Cluster, and from the government side, Mr. Ali Qaed, Head of the IDPs Executive Unit in Taiz. It is worth noting that the delegation had met with the governor of the governorate, head of the local council, Mr. Nabil Shamsan, yesterday, Monday, and discussed with them interventions to meet the needs of the governorate in terms of water, sanitation and nutrition.

headings.text: BCFHD receives the delegation of the United Nations organizations and the German embassy

paragraphs: As part of the field visits in Taiz, which are carried out by the delegation of the United Nations organizations and the German embassy, ​​ Riyadh Shamsan, Director of Programs at the Bena Charity for Human Development BCFHD, as area based coordinator of the IDPs sites in Al-Jahmaliya Al-Wusta area in the Directorate of Salah, received today a delegation of UNICEF and the United Nations Development Program (UNDP) headed by Atsuru Takashi and Sunitaka Suchaya and the head of cooperation in the German Embassy, ​​Marcela Masiarik.

During the visit, which aimed to get acquainted with the humanitarian needs closely, the urgent needs in the field of water and sanitation were presented, as well as the suffering of the IDPs and their basic needs.
During their tour in the IDPs sites, the delegation met the children of Al-Najah School in Al-Jahmaliya, where they listened to some examples of the students.
The delegation was accompanied by Eng. Ali Al-Qubati, coordinator of the WASH Cluster, and from the government side, Mr. Ali Qaed, Head of the IDPs Executive Unit in Taiz.

It is worth noting that the delegation had met with the governor of the governorate, head of the local council, Mr. Nabil Shamsan, yesterday, Monday, and discussed with them interventions to meet the needs of the governorate in terms of water, sanitation and nutrition.

pages.title: Don’t give me a fish every day but teach me how to fish – BCFHD
pages.summary: Don’t give me a fish every day but teach me how to fish 50 % of the population in Yemen depends on the revenues of agricultural production, and 53% of the labor force works in agriculture
pages.content: Don’t give me a fish every day but teach me how to fish 50 % of the population in Yemen depends on the revenues of agricultural production, and 53% of the labor force works in agriculture. Hence, supporting and restoring agricultural livelihoods is the main gateway to food security in Yemen. Accordingly, BCFHD considered this path as one of its priorities; therefore, it has implemented the project Emergency Livelihood Assistance to Address the Negative Impact of Rising Food Prices in Yemen (Taiz Governorate, Al Mawasit District)in partnership with the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO). The project provided 4000 agricultural families in Al-Mawasit District With vegetable seeds and cash assistance, which had a clear impact on improving nutrition, increasing household income, and supplying local markets with types of good agricultural products.

pages.title: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) launches the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies to 200 HHs in Marib City district – Marib governorate – BCFHD
pages.summary: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) launches the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies to 200 HHs in Marib City district – Marib governorate On Tuesday, March 21, 2023,...
pages.content: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) launches the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies to 200 HHs in Marib City district – Marib governorate On Tuesday, March 21, 2023, BCFHD launched the distribution of the first round of cash assistance for rental subsidies to 75 families in Marib City District of Marib governorate. This intervention comes within the activities of a project funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF) to improve the living conditions of the most vulnerable families of IDPs and host community in Marib City district through the provision of quite sustainable shelter solutions. The Project Manager said that today cash assistance would be distributed to 75 families out of 200 families and that the distribution will continue to the rest of the families during the next two days. It is worth noting that each targeted family will receive cash assistance for rental subsidies for a period of six months.

pages.title: (BCFHD) launches the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies to 348 HHs in Salh district – Taiz governorate – BCFHD
pages.summary: (BCFHD) launches the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies to 348 HHs in Salh district – Taiz governorate On Monday, March 20, 2023, BCFHD, in the presence of representatives of...
pages.content: (BCFHD) launches the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies to 348 HHs in Salh district – Taiz governorate On Monday, March 20, 2023, BCFHD, in the presence of representatives of the local authority, launched the distribution of the first round of cash assistance for rental subsidies to 74 families in Salh district of Taiz governorate. This intervention comes within the activities of a project funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF) to improve the living conditions of the most vulnerable families of IDPs, host community and returnees in Salh district through the provision of quite sustainable shelter solutions. Dr. Marwan – the Project Manager – said that today cash assistance would be distributed to 74 families out of 348 families and that the distribution will continue to the rest of the families during the next three days. It is worth noting that each targeted family will receive cash assistance for rental subsidies for a period of six months. The launch was attended by Eng. Aref Al-Yousifi, the General Director of Salh District, who appreciated the efforts made by BCFHD to alleviate the suffering of the most vulnerable families in the district and thanked the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF), the funder of the project.

pages.title: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) starts the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies (the 2nd round) to most vulnerable families – BCFHD
pages.summary: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) starts the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies (the 2nd round) to most vulnerable families On Thursday, April 13, 2023, BCFHD started...
pages.content: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) starts the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies (the 2nd round) to most vulnerable families On Thursday, April 13, 2023, BCFHD started the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies (the 2nd round) to 548 vulnerable families (348 HHs in Salh District – Taiz Gov. and 200 HHs in Marib City District – Marib Gov.). This intervention comes within the activities of a project funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF) to improve the living conditions of the most vulnerable families of IDPs and host community in Marib City district through the provision of quite sustainable shelter solutions. It is worth noting that each targeted family will receive cash assistance for rental subsidies for a period of six months.

pages.title: BCFHD launches the provision of the fourth round of cash incentives to volunteer teachers in Salh District, Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches the provision of the fourth round of cash incentives to volunteer teachers in Salh District, Taiz BCFHD launched the provision of cash incentives to 200 volunteer teachers in Salh...
pages.content: BCFHD launches the provision of the fourth round of cash incentives to volunteer teachers in Salh District, Taiz BCFHD launched the provision of cash incentives to 200 volunteer teachers in Salh district of Taiz governorate, as part of the activities of the YHF funded-project entitled” Improving the educational environment for the vulnerable school-aged children in the affected schools of Salh district, Taiz Governorate, under priority 2″ This is the fourth out of six rounds of monthly cash incentives to 200 volunteer teachers from 21schools in Salh District who were also provided with training program. It is worth noting that the project’s activities include provision of cash incentives and training to volunteer teachers in addition to provision of 527 new double desks, 40 whiteboards with their accessories, Hygiene kits and cleaning materials and solar power systems to the targeted schools in Salh District.

pages.title: Bena Charity launches the distribution of hygiene tools to the sites of the displaced in the Directorate of Salh, Taiz Governorate – BCFHD
pages.summary: Bena Charity launches the distribution of hygiene tools to the sites of the displaced in the Directorate of Salh, Taiz Governorate Today, Wednesday, Bena Charity for Development (BCFHD) has...
pages.content: Bena Charity launches the distribution of hygiene tools to the sites of the displaced in the Directorate of Salh, Taiz Governorate Today, Wednesday, Bena Charity for Development (BCFHD) has inaugurated the distribution of hygiene tools to 8 sites for the displaced in Salh district, Taiz governorate. Within the activities, an opportunity to participate in joint services in 10 sites to review the displaced. Funded by the YHF Humanitarian Fund. Dr. Muhammad Al-Asbahi, the audit and evaluation, said that this activity comes within the activities that the project has provided for the displaced in the Salh district of Taiz governorate. He added that the number of beneficiaries from this activity is approximately 15,000 individuals from the displaced families in the district. The inauguration took place in the presence of M / Aref Al-Yousifi, Director of the Directorate of Hall, Sir/ Ali Qaid, Director of the Executive Unit in the Governorate, the official of the Executive Unit in the Directorate and many project employees.

pages.title: BCFHD launches the distribution of new school desks to targeted schools in Salh District, Taiz – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches the distribution of new school desks to targeted schools in Salh District, Taiz On Sunday 7 May 2023, BCFHD launched the provision of new school desks to 16 targeted schools in...
pages.content: BCFHD launches the distribution of new school desks to targeted schools in Salh District, Taiz On Sunday 7 May 2023, BCFHD launched the provision of new school desks to 16 targeted schools in Salh district of Taiz governorate, as part of the activities of the YHF funded-project entitled” Improving the educational environment for the vulnerable school-aged children in the affected schools of Salh district, Taiz Governorate, under priority 2″ Mr. Zaid Al-Amiri, project manager, said that under this activity 527 new school desks are distributed to 16 targeted schools in Salh district where more than 1,500 students get benefit. The inauguration of the activity was in the presence of Mr. Tariq Al-Hammadi, Executive Manager of BCFHD, Mr. Abdo Ali, Manager of MoSAL Governorate Office, Mr. Aref Abdo Saif, Director of Salh district, Mr. Bagash Al-Mikhlafi, Deputy Manager of Governorate Education Office , Mr. Adel Taher, Head of the Projects Department in Governorate Education Office, and Mr. Muhammad Abdo Hasan, Manager of District Education Office, a number of members of the School Councils and a number of project employees. It is worth noting that the project’s activities include provision of cash incentives and training to volunteer teachers in addition to provision of whiteboards with their accessories, Hygiene kits and cleaning materials and solar power systems to the targeted schools in Salh District.
pages.search_text: BCFHD launches the distribution of new school desks to targeted schools in Salh District, Taiz On Sunday 7 May 2023, BCFHD launched the provision of new school desks to 16 targeted schools in Salh district of Taiz governorate, as part of the activities of the YHF funded-project entitled” Improving the educational environment for the vulnerable school-aged children in the affected schools of Salh district, Taiz Governorate, under priority 2″ Mr. Zaid Al-Amiri, project manager, said that under this activity 527 new school desks are distributed to 16 targeted schools in Salh district where more than 1,500 students get benefit. The inauguration of the activity was in the presence of Mr. Tariq Al-Hammadi, Executive Manager of BCFHD, Mr. Abdo Ali, Manager of MoSAL Governorate Office, Mr. Aref Abdo Saif, Director of Salh district, Mr. Bagash Al-Mikhlafi, Deputy Manager of Governorate Education Office , Mr. Adel Taher, Head of the Projects Department in Governorate Education Office, and Mr. Muhammad Abdo Hasan, Manager of District Education Office, a number of members of the School Councils and a number of project employees. It is worth noting that the project’s activities include provision of cash incentives and training to volunteer teachers in addition to provision of whiteboards with their accessories, Hygiene kits and cleaning materials and solar power systems to the targeted schools in Salh District.

Mr. Zaid Al-Amiri, project manager, said that under this activity 527 new school desks are distributed to 16 targeted schools in Salh district where more than 1,500 students get benefit.

The inauguration of the activity was in the presence of Mr. Tariq Al-Hammadi, Executive Manager of BCFHD, Mr. Abdo Ali, Manager of MoSAL Governorate Office, Mr. Aref Abdo Saif, Director of Salh district, Mr. Bagash Al-Mikhlafi, Deputy Manager of Governorate Education Office , Mr. Adel Taher, Head of the Projects Department in Governorate Education Office, and Mr. Muhammad Abdo Hasan, Manager of District Education Office, a number of members of the School Councils and a number of project employees.

It is worth noting that the project’s activities include provision of cash incentives and training to volunteer teachers in addition to provision of whiteboards with their accessories, Hygiene kits and cleaning materials and solar power systems to the targeted schools in Salh District.

pages.title: Bena Charity inaugurates the work of child-friendly spaces in the sites of the displaced in the Directorate of Salh, Taiz Governorate – BCFHD
pages.summary: Bena Charity inaugurates the work of child-friendly spaces in the sites of the displaced in the Directorate of Salh, Taiz Governorate Today, Wednesday, May 10, 2023, Bena Charity for Human...
pages.content: Bena Charity inaugurates the work of child-friendly spaces in the sites of the displaced in the Directorate of Salh, Taiz Governorate Today, Wednesday, May 10, 2023, Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) launched the activity of distributing child-friendly spaces in 6 sites for the displaced in the Directorate of Salh, Taiz Governorate. Within the activities of the project to enhance safe and comprehensive access to multi-sector services in 10 sites to host the displaced in the Salh district of Taiz governorate and three sites in Ma’rib governorate through improving the supervision and coordination of the sites It is funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF). Mr. Riyad Shamsan, project manager, said that this activity comes within the activities provided by the project to the displaced in the Salh district of Taiz governorate, which aims to alleviate the psychological effects of the displaced children as a result of the ongoing war in the country. It is worth noting that, in the previous period, hygiene materials were distributed to 8 sites for the displaced in the district. The inauguration took place in the presence of M/ Aref Al-Yousifi, Director of the Hall Directorate, Mr. Ahmed Obaid, Director of the Executive Unit in the Directorate of Hall, and a number of project employees.

pages.title: (BCFHD) Launches the Distribution of Cash Assistance for Affected House Rehabilitation and Reconstruction to 70 HHs in AlMudhaffar District – Taiz Governorate. – BCFHD
pages.summary: (BCFHD) Launches the Distribution of Cash Assistance for Affected House Rehabilitation and Reconstruction to 70 HHs in AlMudhaffar District – Taiz Governorate
pages.content: (BCFHD) Launches the Distribution of Cash Assistance for Affected House Rehabilitation and Reconstruction to 70 HHs in AlMudhaffar District – Taiz Governorate. On Monday, May 15, 2023, BCFHD, in the presence of the local authority of AlMudhaffar district, launched the distribution of the first payment of cash assistance for house rehabilitation and reconstruction to 33 HHs of returnees in AlMudhaffar District – Taiz governorate. This intervention comes within the activities of a project funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF) to improve the living conditions of the most vulnerable families of returnees and to sustain their returns in AlMudhaffar District through the provision of sustainable shelter solutions. Dr. Marwan – the Project Manager – said that today cash assistance for house rehabilitation would be distributed to 33 families out of 70 families and that the distribution will continue to the rest of the families during tomorrow. It is worth noting that the cash assistance for house rehabilitation will be delivered in three payments to facilitate monitoring the rehabilitation works and to ensure using the cash assistance in line with its purpose. The launch was attended by Mr. Tawfiq Al-Yousufi, the Secretary-General of BCFHD, and Mr. Tariq Al-Fohaid, Head of the Services Committee in AlMudhaffar District, who appreciated the efforts made by BCFHD to alleviate the suffering of the most vulnerable families in the district and thanked the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF), the funder of the project.

pages.title: (BCFHD) launches the provision of shelter maintenance and upgrade to 300 HHs of IDPs in Al-Kharashi Site in Marib Al Wadi District – Marib Governorate – BCFHD
pages.summary: (BCFHD) launches the provision of shelter maintenance and upgrade to 300 HHs of IDPs in Al-Kharashi Site in Marib Al Wadi District – Marib Governorate On Sunday, May 14, 2023, BCFHD, in the...
pages.content: (BCFHD) launches the provision of shelter maintenance and upgrade to 300 HHs of IDPs in Al-Kharashi Site in Marib Al Wadi District – Marib Governorate On Sunday, May 14, 2023, BCFHD, in the presence of the Coordinator of Shelter Dept. in the ExU Mr. Ahmed Al-Qufaili and the Engineer of the Shelter Cluster in Marib hub Eng. Ameen Al Magbool, launched the provision of shelter maintenance and upgrade to 300 HHs of IDPs in Al-Kharashi Site in Marib Al Wadi District – Marib Governorate. This intervention comes within the activities of a project funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF) to ensure the safety and security and protection from climate conditions for the most vulnerable families of IDPs living in IDPs hosting sites. Mr. Sulaiman Al-Samadi – the Project Officer – said that today the maintenance materials would be distributed to 39 families out of 300 families and that the distribution of maintenance materials continue to the rest of the families during May and June, 2023. It is worth noting that each targeted family will receive maintenance materials as well as CfW assistance to be able to conduct the maintenance works for their shelters. Mr. Ahmed Al-Qufaili, the Coordinator of Shelter Dept. in the ExU – Marib, appreciated the efforts made by BCFHD to alleviate the suffering of the most vulnerable families of IDPs in Marib Al Wadi District and thanked the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF), the funder of the project

pages.title: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) hosts the Shelter Sub-National Cluster – Aden Hub to conduct a coordination meeting with partners – BCFHD
pages.summary: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) hosts the Shelter Sub-National Cluster – Aden Hub to conduct a coordination meeting with partners On 10th of May, 2023, BCFHD hosted, in its...
pages.content: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) hosts the Shelter Sub-National Cluster – Aden Hub to conduct a coordination meeting with partners On 10th of May, 2023, BCFHD hosted, in its headquarters in Taiz, the Shelter Sub-national Cluster – Aden Hub to conduct an ad hoc coordination meeting with partners concerned with damaged house rehabilitation works in Taiz. The ad hoc meeting was allocated to discuss mainly three main points: – Updates on the rehabilitation of damaged houses activities in Taiz city. – Updates on the cluster partner’s response to the flood-affected people in Taiz. – The needs to conduct needs assessment for the emergency shelter needs due to recent Rainfall and Flash Floods At the beginning, Mr. Saleem Al Azazi, the Shelter Sub-National Cluster Coordinator – Aden Hub, welcomed the participants and thanked them for their coming. In the meeting, Mr. Al Azazi stressed the importance of implementing the rehabilitation works for the damaged houses as stated in the work plans to mitigate the suffering of the targeted vulnerable households. Mr. Al Azazi also commended the efforts of the partners and requested them to conduct Needs Assessment for the emergency shelter needs due to recent Rainfall and Flash Floods At the end of the meeting, Mr. Al Azazi thanked BCFHF for hosting the meeting.

pages.title: BCFHD launches the distribution of solar energy systems and hygiene kits to schools in Salh district of Taiz Governorate – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD launches the distribution of solar energy systems and hygiene kits to schools in Salh district of Taiz Governorate BCFHD launched on Thursday, May 18, 2023 the distribution of solar energy...
pages.content: BCFHD launches the distribution of solar energy systems and hygiene kits to schools in Salh district of Taiz Governorate BCFHD launched on Thursday, May 18, 2023 the distribution of solar energy systems to 4 schools and hygiene kits to 5 schools in Salh district of Taiz Governorate , as part of tye activities of the YHF funded-project entitled” Improving the educational environment for the vulnerable school-aged children in the affected schools of Salh district, Taiz Governorate, under priority 2″Mr. Zaid Al-Amiri, the project manager, stated that these activities aim to support the educational process in targeted schools in Salh district. The inauguration was attended by Mr. Tarek Al-Hammadi, the executive manager of BCFHD, Dr. Mahmoud Al-Bukhari, the deputy manager of MoSAL Governorate Office, Mr. Aref Abdo Saif, the director of Salh district, Mr. Abdulwasea Shdad, the manager of Governorate Education Office, Mr. Mohammed Abdo Hassan, the manager of Salh district Education Office and a a number of members of the School Councils and a number of project staff. It is worth noting that the project activities include provision of cash incentives and training to volunteer teachers in addition to provision of new school desks, whiteboards with their accessories, Hygiene kits and cleaning materials and solar power systems to a number of targeted schools in Salh District.

pages.title: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) conducts the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies (the 3rd round) to most vulnerable families. – BCFHD
pages.summary: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) conducts the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies (the 3rd round) to most vulnerable families
pages.content: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) conducts the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies (the 3rd round) to most vulnerable families. BCFHD started the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies (the 3rd round) to 548 vulnerable families (348 HHs in Salh District – Taiz Gov. and 200 HHs in Marib City District – Marib Gov.). This intervention comes within the activities of a project funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF) to improve the living conditions of the most vulnerable families of IDPs and host community in Marib City district through the provision of quite sustainable shelter solutions. It is worth noting that each targeted family will receive cash assistance for rental subsidies for six rounds.

pages.title: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) condemns the assassination of the director of the World Food Program (WFP) office in Taiz, Muyad Hamidi. – BCFHD
pages.summary: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) condemns the assassination of the director of the World Food Program (WFP) office in Taiz, Muyad Hamidi
pages.content: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) condemns the assassination of the director of the World Food Program (WFP) office in Taiz, Muyad Hamidi. Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) condemns the assassination of the director of the World Food Program (WFP) office in Taiz, Muyad Hamidi. BCFHD strongly condemns the cowardly attack that resulted in the death of Mr. Hamidi on Friday, July 21, 2023; We extends our deepest condolences to his family, as well as to the WFP and its offices in Yemen, and to all its employees. BCFHD declares its full solidarity with them during these difficult circumstances. This heinous crime targets the World Food Program and its significant humanitarian role in assisting the Yemeni people, es pecially in Taiz, by providing food rations to millions of displaced and affected persons by the war and humanitarian crisis in Yemen. We call on the authorities in the province and security services to urgently arrest the perpetrators and bring them to justice. BCFHD emphasizes the importance of supporting humanitarian work and protecting those who work in this vital field. We also call on the Yemeni government to condemn these heinous terrorist acts and to cooperate in providing full protection for relief workers and providing the necessary humanitarian needs for the Yemeni people in these difficult times. We ask our God to have mercy on the deceased and grant him a place in paradise, and to bless his family and loved ones with patience and solace. Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) Friday, July 21, 2023.

pages.title: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) starts the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies (the 4th round) to most vulnerable families. – BCFHD
pages.summary: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) starts the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies (the 4th round) to most vulnerable families
pages.content: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) starts the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies (the 4th round) to most vulnerable families. On Monday, July 31, 2023, BCFHD started the distribution of cash assistance for rental subsidies (the 4 th round) to 548 vulnerable families (348 HHs in Salh District – T aiz Gov. and 200 HHs in Marib City District – Marib Gov.). This intervention comes within the activities of a project funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF) to improve the living conditions of the most vulnerable families of IDPs and host community in Marib City district through the provision of quite sustainable shelter solutions. It is worth noting that each targeted family will receive cash assistance for rental subsidies for a period of six months.

pages.summary: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) Distributes Cash Assistance for Affected House Rehabilitation and Reconstruction (the 2nd payment) to 70 HHs in AlMudhaffar District – Taiz Governorate
pages.content: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) Distributes Cash Assistance for Affected House Rehabilitation and Reconstruction (the 2nd payment) to 70 HHs in AlMudhaffar District – Taiz Governorate. On Wednesday, August 2, 2023, BCFHD distributed the SECOND payment of cash assistance for house rehabilitation and reconstruction to 70 HHs of returnees in AlMudhaffar District – Taiz governorate. This intervention comes within the activities of a project funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF) to improve the living conditions of the most vulnerable families of returnees and to sustain their returns in AlMudhaffar District through the provision of sustainable shelter solutions. It is worth noting that the cash assistance for house rehabilitation will be delivered in three payments to facilitate monitoring the rehabilitation works and to ensure using the cash assistance in line with its purpose.

pages.title: BCFHD concluded the provision of school supplies to targeted schools in Salh district of Taiz Governorate, Yemen. – BCFHD
pages.summary: BCFHD concluded the provision of school supplies to targeted schools in Salh district of Taiz Governorate, Yemen
pages.content: BCFHD concluded the provision of school supplies to targeted schools in Salh district of Taiz Governorate, Yemen. Under the YHF-funded project ” Improving the educational Environment for the vulnerable school-aged children in the affected Schools of Salh district, Taiz Governorate, under prionity (2)”. BCFHD concluded the provision of school supplies to targeted schools in Salh district of Taiz Governorate, Yemen. In coordination with Salh district Education office (DEO), BCFHD distributed 55 whiteboards with their supplis to 16 schools along with 8 hygiene kits and cleaning materials to 8 schools. The project was successfully implemented in Salh District of Taiz Governorate, Yemen. This project is considered as an important step towards improving the quality of education in conflict-affected areas in Yemen. It is worth mentioning, that this project aims to improve education quality in 21 conflict-affected schools in Salh district through the provision of a package of education inputs including new school desks, whiteboards with their supplies, solar power systems, and hygiene kits.

pages.title: World Humanitarian Day 2023 – BCFHD
pages.summary: World Humanitarian Day 2023 On World Humanitarian Day, humanitarian workers in Yemen celebrate with the United Nations on this 20th anniversary
pages.content: World Humanitarian Day 2023 On World Humanitarian Day, humanitarian workers in Yemen celebrate with the United Nations on this 20th anniversary. This time is to commend the work of all humanitarian workers who dedicate their professional lives to helping the needy and those affected by the war for the ninth consecutive year. According to UN statistics, the number of people in need of humanitarian assistance in Yemen this year has reached 21 million. Year after year, the Yemeni humanitarian community struggles to reach the level of challenges posed by the expansion of humanitarian operations despite the existing obstacles. The determination and dedication of humanitarian workers enable them to reach the most difficult and dangerous places to carry out their mission and implement their interventions. On World Humanitarian Day, it is important to highlight that humanitarian work may be one of the few threads, if not the only thread, that unites humanity in its agreement on its importance. Humanitarian work has become the lifeline extended to any nation during times of escalating crises, halted life domains, and dysfunctional governments. Therefore, it is incumbent upon everyone to cooperate, collaborate, and move forward in facilitating and implementing humanitarian work to include all individuals affected by the war in all governorates of the republic as much as possible.

pages.title: Bena Charity For Human Development (BCFHD) concludes IDP Sites Management and Coordination Project in Taiz and Marib Governorates. – BCFHD
pages.summary: Bena Charity For Human Development (BCFHD) concludes IDP Sites Management and Coordination Project in Taiz and Marib Governorates
pages.content: Bena Charity For Human Development (BCFHD) concludes IDP Sites Management and Coordination Project in Taiz and Marib Governorates. (BCFHD) concluded the IDP sites management and coordination project in Taiz and Marib governorates, after implementing several activities aimed at improving living conditions for IDPs, in cooperation and participation with the local community, funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF). In Taiz, several maintenance activities carried out at IDP sites in Sala district including the following: Constructing an 81-meter-long protective wall to protect IDPs from rain flood risks. Maintenance of the sewage system at IDP sites. Maintenance of the new building at the Health Institute. Maintenance of the water network at IDP sites. In addition, 7 community projects were implemented in 6 IDP hosting sites. These projects included establishing child-friendly spaces by providing Garden-child Tools consists of (swings-slides-trampoline). Moreover, 8 other community projects were implemented including distribution of cleaning tools and conducting cleaning campaigns at 8 sites. While in Marib, the project involved carrying out several activities in all sites managed by (BCFHD) , they are as under: – Al-Faw site in Marib City district. – Al-Manfa site in Marib City district. and – Al-Husoon site in Marib Al-Wadi district. The beginning was with the implementation of a number of maintenance activities, most notably: Training fire safety committees, distributing 400 fire extinguishers, and conducting fire safety awareness campaigns at the three sites. Installation of 40 street lighting units for the three sites. Rehabilitation of the water source (main well) at Al-Faw site was completed that serving more than 423 families. Suction of sewage in a total quantity of 2005 cubic meters at the three sites. Moreover, 10 community projects were implemented including distribution of cleaning items and conducting cleaning campaigns at the three sites. It is worth mentioning that (BCFHD) , with the participation of the local community and funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF), sought through this project to improve the living conditions of IDPs in Taiz and Marib and enable them to have a better, more comfortable, and safer life. The project aimed to enhance hygiene and public health at these sites, and raise awareness about the importance of personal and environmental cleanliness.

pages.title: 💙🌍 Peace: Our Path to Sustainable Development! 🌍💙 – BCFHD
pages.summary: 💙🌍 Peace: Our Path to Sustainable Development 🌍💙 In Bena Charity for Human Development, we strongly believe that peace is a fundamental pillar for achieving sustainable development
pages.content: 💙🌍 Peace: Our Path to Sustainable Development! 🌍💙 In Bena Charity for Human Development, we strongly believe that peace is a fundamental pillar for achieving sustainable development. Our journey towards peace leads to shared global goals. Peace is more than the absence of conflicts; it is a state of peaceful coexistence among individuals and communities. We realize that promoting peace requires collective and sustainable efforts from everyone. When we work together for peace, we contribute to building strong and prosperous societies. Peace enhances cooperation and solidarity, enabling us to achieve social, economic, and environmental justice. We strive to promote peace through various initiatives and programs. We seek to foster understanding and dialogue among different cultures, promoting values of respect, tolerance, and coexistence. Achieving peace starts from within, and thus, we urge individuals to be ambassadors of peace in their daily lives. Small changes in our behavior and interactions with others can make a significant difference in building a culture of peace. Let us work together to fulfill our aspirations and humanitarian responsibility in serving peace.

paragraphs: In Bena Charity for Human Development, we strongly believe that peace is a fundamental pillar for achieving sustainable development. Our journey towards peace leads to shared global goals.

Peace is more than the absence of conflicts; it is a state of peaceful coexistence among individuals and communities. We realize that promoting peace requires collective and sustainable efforts from everyone.

When we work together for peace, we contribute to building strong and prosperous societies. Peace enhances cooperation and solidarity, enabling us to achieve social, economic, and environmental justice.
We strive to promote peace through various initiatives and programs. We seek to foster understanding and dialogue among different cultures, promoting values of respect, tolerance, and coexistence.

Achieving peace starts from within, and thus, we urge individuals to be ambassadors of peace in their daily lives. Small changes in our behavior and interactions with others can make a significant difference in building a culture of peace.

pages.title: “Successful Safeguarding Training Workshop Held by Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD)” – BCFHD
pages.summary: “Successful Safeguarding Training Workshop Held by Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD)” Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) recently organized a successful one-day training workshop...
pages.content: “Successful Safeguarding Training Workshop Held by Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD)” Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) recently organized a successful one-day training workshop on S afeguarding . The workshop had a total of 37 participants, including both male and female employees. The training was conducted by Mrs. Eftikar Al-Shamiri, the S afeguarding Manager at Oxfam. The primary objective of the workshop was to enhance the participants’ skills and knowledge in S afeguarding . Mrs. Eftikar Al-Shamiri delivered engaging lectures, sharing her expertise and experiences in the S afeguarding . The participants actively participated and benefited from the practical insights and knowledge exchange during the workshop.

headings.text: “Successful Safeguarding Training Workshop Held by Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD)”

paragraphs: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD)recently organized a successful one-day training workshop on Safeguarding. The workshop had a total of 37 participants, including both male and female employees. The training was conducted by Mrs. Eftikar Al-Shamiri, the SafeguardingManager at Oxfam.

The primary objective of the workshop was to enhance the participants’ skills and knowledge in Safeguarding. Mrs. Eftikar Al-Shamiri delivered engaging lectures, sharing her expertise and experiences in the Safeguarding. pages.title: “Funded by Pure Hands Organization, Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) inaugurates a project to construct 20 temporary housing units for displaced people in Al-Ma’afir Directorate.” – BCFHD
pages.summary: “Funded by Pure Hands Organization, Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) inaugurates a project to construct 20 temporary housing units for displaced people in Al-Ma’afir Directorate
pages.content: “Funded by Pure Hands Organization, Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) inaugurates a project to construct 20 temporary housing units for displaced people in Al-Ma’afir Directorate.” In a step aimed at providing temporary housing for displaced people and enhancing relief and humanitarian development efforts, Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD), with funding from Pure Hands Organization, has Inaugurated a new project that includes the construction of 20 temporary housing units in Al-Ma’afir Directorate. This project aims to provide safe and suitable shelter for 20 families of displaced people who have been forced to flee due to armed conflicts and harsh conditions in the region. The temporary housing units have been designed to meet the needs of the displaced people and provide a conducive living environment, each consisting of two rooms, a hall, a kitchen, and a bathroom. The project’s official opening was attended by Dr. Mohammed Al-Hajjaji, the President of Pure Hands Organization, Dr. Abdulmajid Al-Sha’abi, the Country Director of the organization, Mr. Najib Ghazi, the Executive Director of the organization, Mr. Mohammed Abdulaziz Al-Sanawi, the Deputy Governor, Mr. Adel Al-Mashmir, the Director of Al-Ma’afir Directorate, and Dr. Abdul Kareem Shamsan, the President of Bena Charity. This step is part of the shelter projects undertaken by Bena Charity, which aims to improve the living conditions of displaced people and provide them with necessary support. The association works closely with local authorities and other humanitarian organizations to provide basic services and aid in achieving sustainable development in the region. Commenting on the official opening of the project, Dr. Abdul Kareem Shamsan, the President of Bena Charity, stated, “We are proud to implement this important project that will provide a safe shelter for displaced people and contribute to improving their living conditions. We are committed to providing the necessary support to those in need, and we will continue to implement humanitarian development projects to serve the community.” This project will benefit 20 displaced families by providing them with temporary housing to alleviate their suffering and create a safe environment that helps them rebuild their lives. It represents a positive step towards enhancing relief and humanitarian development and providing support to the displaced people in the area. This project is part of the ongoing efforts of Bena Charity to provide assistance to those in need and meet their various needs in different fields. It is expected to have a significant positive impact on the lives of the displaced people and contribute to promoting stability and sustainable development in Al-Ma’afir Directorate. The inauguration was attended by Mr. Ali Qaid, the Director of the Executive Unit for Displaced People in the Governorate, Mr. Bassam Al-Haddad, the Director of the Executive Unit in the Directorate, Dr. Mahmoud Al-Bakari, the Deputy Director of the Social Affairs and Labor Office, Mr. Qaid Saad, the representative of the Planning and International Cooperation Office, Mr. Tawfiq Abdulkhabeer, the Secretary-General of Bena Charity, Mr. Suleiman Al-Samadi, the Projects Manager at the Association, and Mr. Zaher Al-Yousefi, the Project Engineer.

pages.title: “Unconditional Cash Assistance Distributed to 1,500 Beneficiaries in Dhubab District”. – BCFHD
pages.summary: “Unconditional Cash Assistance Distributed to 1,500 Beneficiaries in Dhubab District”
pages.content: “Unconditional Cash Assistance Distributed to 1,500 Beneficiaries in Dhubab District”. As part of the “The Integrated Livelihood Support in Areas at Risk of Famine” project, the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO), in partnership with Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD), has implemented a project to distribute unconditional cash assistance to 1,500 beneficiaries in Dhubab district. The distribution took place from October 16th to October 24th, 2023. The objective of this cash assistance is to alleviate the financial burdens on affected families in the region and enable them to meet their basic needs. This initiative is part of the international community’s efforts to address the humanitarian challenges and famine crisis in Yemen. The project was funded through the UN Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), which aims to provide support and assistance to crisis-affected areas. This strong collaboration between FAO and BCFHD reflects their shared commitment to improving living conditions and providing social protection for the most vulnerable communities. It is expected that this cash assistance will contribute to improving the living conditions of the beneficiary families in Dhubab district, offering them an opportunity for recovery and stability amidst challenging circumstances.

The project was funded through the UN Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), which aims to provide support and assistance to crisis-affected areas.
This strong collaboration between FAO and BCFHD reflects their shared commitment to improving living conditions and providing social protection for the most vulnerable communities.

It is expected that this cash assistance will contribute to improving the living conditions of the beneficiary families inDhubabdistrict, offering them an opportunity for recovery and stability amidst challenging circumstances.

pages.title: “Training of 1,500 women on family nutrition funded by the United Nations.” – BCFHD
pages.summary: “Training of 1,500 women on family nutrition funded by the United Nations
pages.content: “Training of 1,500 women on family nutrition funded by the United Nations.” Under the project “The Integrated Livelihood Support in Areas at Risk of Famine”, funded by the United Nations Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), a BCFHD, in partnership along the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO), conducted a nutritional awareness training in the Directorate of Dhubab. The activity included training of 1,500 women of childbearing age (18-45 years) on family nutrition, and continued for 6 days. The training was carried out by nutritionists who were nominated by the Health Bureau in accordance with the standards approved by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO). These specialists received a five-day training workshop from FAO’s Feeding Unit in Aden. The course aimed to raise nutritional awareness among women of reproductive age and enable them to make healthy decisions regarding family nutrition. and contributing to health promotion, quality nutrition and improved livelihoods in society. This training is part of the comprehensive project’s efforts to support affected families and promote the sustainability of livelihoods in areas most at risk of starvation. The project seeks to empower women and enhance their role in achieving healthy and sustainable nutrition for themselves and their families.

pages.title: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) has been granted membership in the Strategic Advisory Group of the Education SAG, following the registration and nomination process by civil society organizations. – BCFHD
pages.summary: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) has been granted membership in the Strategic Advisory Group of the Education SAG, following the registration and nomination process by civil society...
pages.content: Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) has been granted membership in the Strategic Advisory Group of the Education SAG, following the registration and nomination process by civil society organizations. After the registration and nomination process conducted by civil society organizations, we are pleased to announce that Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD) has been granted membership in the Strategic Advisory Group of the Education SAG. BCFHD is recognized as an active entity in the field of public education in emergency situations, with extensive experience in implementing educational programs, projects, and activities. We would like to express our deep gratitude to all organizations, institutions, associations, and the Education SAG for entrusting us with this opportunity. We will actively contribute as a member of the group and strive to earn the trust of our partners. We look forward to collaborating and coordinating with all stakeholders involved in the advisory group, and we are committed to making every possible effort to enhance and develop the education sector. We hope that we have gained the confidence of our partners and fellow members in the group. We anticipate fruitful cooperation and pledge to provide effective and meaningful contributions to the promotion and development of education and to achieve positive change in the field of education for the benefit of society and individuals.

pages.title: “Bena Charity” held the Kick-off Workshop for the project “Provision of Comprehensive Emergency and Life-saving WASH Assistance to Vulnerable IDPs and Host Communities in Salh and Al Qahirah Districts Taiz.”. – BCFHD
pages.summary: “Bena Charity” held the Kick-off Workshop for the project “Provision of Comprehensive Emergency and Life-saving WASH Assistance to Vulnerable IDPs and Host Communities in Salh and Al Qahirah...
pages.content: “Bena Charity” held the Kick-off Workshop for the project “Provision of Comprehensive Emergency and Life-saving WASH Assistance to Vulnerable IDPs and Host Communities in Salh and Al Qahirah Districts Taiz.”. This morning, the Kick-off Workshop of the project “Provision of Comprehensive Emergency and Life-saving WASH Assistance to Vulnerable IDPs and Host Communities in Salh and Al Qahirah Districts Taiz.”. in Yemen was held with funding from the YHF and conducts by BCFHD. The project aims at providing access to safe and adequate drinking water and improving the health and hygiene status of displaced persons and vulnerable host communities in the districts of Salh and Al Qahirah -Taiz. The project addresses the basic needs of displaced persons and host communities in target areas and provides urgent and comprehensive water, sanitation and hygiene assistance. The inaugural workshop included an interactive session and presentations on the project’s objectives, activities and indicators, challenges and risks that could be addressed during project implementation and how to mitigate them.

pages.title: A kick-off Workshop for the “Provision of integrated response of education and child protection services to the most volunerable children in Maqbanah district, Taiz under pillar1”. – BCFHD
pages.summary: A kick-off Workshop for the “Provision of integrated response of education and child protection services to the most volunerable children in Maqbanah district, Taiz under pillar1”
pages.content: A kick-off Workshop for the “Provision of integrated response of education and child protection services to the most volunerable children in Maqbanah district, Taiz under pillar1”. With funding from (YHF), the BCFHD conducted the Kick-off Workshop for the “Provision of integrated response of education and child protection services to the most volunerable children in Maqbanah district, Taiz under pillar1”, which aims to provide an integrated package in the field of education and protection for 6034 affected children in Maqbanah district. The Kick-off Workshop aimed at strengthening cooperation between the Society, the community and government bodies; to ensure an effective and comprehensive response. Discussions centred on clarifying the overall objective of the project, expected outputs, project activities in education, targeted schools, protection activities and the scope of targeting to achieve positive change in children’s lives. The project targets 6034 of the most affected children in Maqbanah district , seeks to provide a safe and child-friendly learning environment, enhances their abilities and helps them achieve their future ambitions. The Director of Maqbanah, Mr. Hamed Al-Khulidi commended the importance of the project and the integration of protection and education activities that meet the needs of the largest important segment of society, namely children.

pages.title: A workshop to Building the capacities of the project field team regarding the child protection related issues. – BCFHD
pages.summary: A workshop to Building the capacities of the project field team regarding the child protection related issues
pages.content: A workshop to Building the capacities of the project field team regarding the child protection related issues. BCFHD organized a workshop as part of the project “Provision of integrated response of education and child protection services to the most vulnerable children in Maqbanah district, Taiz under pillar1” No. 25861, funded by YHF. The primary objective of the workshop was to enhance the capacities of the project field team regarding child protection issues. The workshop aimed to improve the team’s knowledge and skills related to providing care and protection for the highly affected children in the district. The workshop had a total of 10 participants, including project management, monitoring and evaluation staff. It employed a comprehensive training approach that covered both theoretical and practical aspects of child protection. Topics covered included safeguarding, PSEA, psychological first aid, centrality of protection, and safe referral to specialized services. The project’s overall goal is to enhance education and protection services for the most affected children in Maqbanah district by empowering and strengthening the capabilities of the field team. The workshop exemplifies the continuous commitment and endeavors of BCFHD and YHF to enhance capacities and knowledge among protection and education workers. These efforts contribute to achieving sustainable development goals and mitigating the adverse impacts on Yemen’s most vulnerable children.

pages.title: “Distribution of 4,500 bags of animal feed concentrate and 4,500 cubes of mineral blocks to support poor families in The Dhubab-Yemen.” – BCFHD
pages.summary: “Distribution of 4,500 bags of animal feed concentrate and 4,500 cubes of mineral blocks to support poor families in The Dhubab-Yemen
pages.content: “Distribution of 4,500 bags of animal feed concentrate and 4,500 cubes of mineral blocks to support poor families in The Dhubab-Yemen.” Within the project “The Integrated Livelihood Support in Areas at Risk of Famine” in Dhubab districts-Taiz the distribution team completed the distribution of 4,500 bags of Animal Feed Concentrate and 4,500 cubes of mineral blocks to 1,500 Households. The project is funded by the United Nations Central Emergency Response Fund, and implemented by Food and Agriculture Organisation of the United Nation (FAO) in partnership with Bena Charity for Human Development (BCFHD). This food assistance to animals aims to support poor families at risk of starvation, giving them the power to resist and restore livelihoods. The provided Animal Feed Concentrate and mineral blocks help to improve livestock feeding status and increase production, thereby enhancing families’ sustainability and improving their income. It should be noted that this activity is part of a comprehensive package of aid, where 6,000 sheep will also be provided to these families, as well as nutrition training and cash assistance. These integrated efforts are aimed at improving the living and economic conditions of vulnerable families in the Dhubab District. This intervention contributes in improving families’ sustainability and increasing their capacity to achieve self-sufficiency.

pages.title: Training of 24 members of the Child Protection Committee. – BCFHD
pages.summary: Training of 24 members of the Child Protection Committee
pages.content: Training of 24 members of the Child Protection Committee. Within the project “Provision of integrated response of education and child protection services to the most vulnerable children in Maqbanah district, Taiz .” funded by the Yemen Humanitarian Fund (YHF), BCFHD trained the child protection committees on child protection risks and safe referral pathways. The training aimed to empower child protection committees with the knowledge and skills to recognize and address risks faced by children, ensure their safety, and enhance their understanding of safe referral pathways. This project aims to provide a comprehensive and integrated response to meet the educational and protection needs of the most affected children in the area. Through this training, BCFHD equipped the committees to effectively mitigate potential risks and safeguard children’s well-being, promoting a culture of child protection and fostering collaboration among stakeholders for the benefit of vulnerable children in society.

pages.title: A veterinary team visited a quarantine in Dhubab to support livelihoods and pastoral nutrition. – BCFHD
pages.summary: A veterinary team visited a quarantine in Dhubab to support livelihoods and pastoral nutrition
pages.content: A veterinary team visited a quarantine in Dhubab to support livelihoods and pastoral nutrition. Special | Bena Charity for Human Development for Human Development (BCFHD) Within the project “The Integrated Livelihood Support in Famine Risk prone areas in Yemen- Dhubab District Taiz”, a specialized veterinary team today visited Dhubab District in Taiz Governorate. The team consisted of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO), represented by Dr. Abdul Karim Al-Bukair, and the representative of the Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Fishery Walefare (MAIFW) Dr. Owsan Muhammad Saleh, in addition to Dr. Dirham Al-Qadasi, President of the Veterinary Association, and the participation of Dr. Faisal Al-Sabri, BCFHD Livelihood Projects Coordinator. The quarantine, where the quarantined sheep were inspected was visited to inspect the quarantied female goats and ensure their safety, in addition to reviewing the results of the veterinary examination before distributing them. It is worth mentioning that the project, as part of its package of services, includes distributing 6,000 heads of productive female goats to 1,500 families in the Dhubab District, at a rate of 4 heads per family. This aim at improving pastoral livelihoods and improving families’ food sewurity and nutrition of these targeted families.
